column2: text

[[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ambushes]]Ambushes[[/sl]] are much less effective against a [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] army in [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance.

An army in [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance will be more effective at intercepting nearby enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] moving through the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]], [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_beast_paths]]Beast-paths[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]].

The distance an army can see on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] is increased when using [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance. However, the distance it can move per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] is decreased.

A selected Lizardmen army may be switched into [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance using the stances rollout on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].
Armies with low [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness will suffer losses due to [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.

The nine accursed Books of Nagash are the most powerful source of necromantic magic in the world. In the Eye of the Vortex campaign, [[sl:campaign_tomb_kings]]Tomb King[[/sl]] factions seek to collect these books in order to gain control over the Black Pyramid.

The Sword of Khaine is a blade of ancient and terrible power. To its bearer it grants prodigious strength in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], yet stewardship of the sword can lead to civil unrest over time.
Black Arks may only be recruited from coastal settlements.
Unlock unit upgrades and Doom-Rockets through the Forbidden Workshop panel.
Post-Waaagh! Blues
Colonise Ruins
If an enemy settlement cannot be occupied then this is indicated on the settlement tooltip when a controlled army is selected.
Wizards are usually vulnerable to physical attack.

Pieces of Eight are cursed trinkets that have so completely twisted and altered the minds of those that first found them that their fate is now tied to the coins. By securing one of the Pieces of Eight, the services of the warriors bound to them may be secured also.

[[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]] terrorise their enemies and bolster their economies by capturing [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Those unfortunate enough to survive a defeat by the Dark Elves know their fate is to be worked to death in one of the many mines of Naggaroth.
Wizard and other [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero units contain a single character, without any accompanying troops
The spells available to a Wizard are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_panel]]Winds of Magic panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when the wizard is [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]].
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_bestial_rage_link]]Bestial Rage[[/sl_tooltip]]
Wizards are often also the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lord[[/sl]] of the [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]], or a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero from the campaign map.

The verminous Skaven are a [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] of malevolent and self-serving ratmen. From their [[sl:campaign_skaven_underworld]]Under-Empire cities[[/sl]], they fight tooth and claw against the other races – and each other – to further their personal standing within the Skaven hierarchy and to serve their diabolical god, the Horned Rat.
We have attained complete control of this [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]]province[[/tooltip]][[/url]].
[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]], [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]Raiding[[/sl]]
If the battle is a siege then the [[sl:campaign_siege_panel]]Siege panel[[/sl]] is shown instead.
Right-click to attack the settlement\nLeft-click to inspect
Captives killed:
Rogue Pirates
Recruitment for a unit that's already enqueued may be cancelled by left-clicking on its card on the Army panel.
Alarielle, the High Elf champion of the Earth-Goddess, radiates life magic, which invigorates the lands through which she travels. When she crosses controlled territory it will receive bonuses.
Dwarfs
Camera Controls

Acts of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry exemplify the Knightly Order for [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnian factions[[/sl]]. Great benefits are bestowed upon those who follow the Grail Companions' code.
The number of [[img:ui/skins/warhammer2/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]Scrolls of Hekarti this settlement produces per turn.
Most [[sl:battle_unit_types]]troop-types[[/sl]] can be hidden in forests.
Units with the high ground enjoy a significant advantage when fighting on sloped terrain.
Steep slopes are impassable, and may be used to cover the [[sl:battle_flanking]]flank[[/sl]] of an [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]].
Hills and other terrain features can obscure visibility, allowing units to hide from their enemy’s line of sight.

The Empire is the largest of all the domains of men, defended against the various evils that face it by the discipline and bravery of its [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]]. The [[sl:campaign_settlements]]burghs and cities[[/sl]] of the Empire stand as beacons of civilisation in a savage world.
Sacking a settlement does not capture it but strips it of all its valuables. [[sl:campaign_razing]]Razing[[/sl]] a settlement will destroy it and no-one shall own it.
The tooltip on each option button shows information about that option and the consequences it carries.
Occupying or looting a settlement will transfer its ownership to the victor.
More options are available if the winners and losers are of the same [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]].
Sacrifice of Xahutec\n\n[[col:green]]Unlocks a random Banner
Sacrifice of Quetza\n\n[[col:green]]Unlocks a random Banner
Sacrifice of Qu'ittax\n\n[[col:green]]Unlocks a random Banner
Sacrifice of Aymara\n\n[[col:green]]Unlocks a random Banner
The strength of the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] is indicated on the Pre-Battle panel if a user of magic is present.

The greatest of all fears has come true, the Druchii have enacted their final ritual. The legions of the Witch King defile Ulthuan’s heart. Malekith intends to step into the Vortex and claim its power, which will surely mean the end of the Asur! You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Dark Elves from claiming victory!
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_offices_link]]Offices[[/sl_tooltip]]
Brayherds Disbanded
Very low [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage

The followers of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption where they pillage and [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raid[[/sl]]. This [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] despoils the land, making it unsuitable for those who have not given themselves to the Ruinous Powers.

The [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is a measure of its will to continue fighting. If the [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a unit drops too low then the troops will rout from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] and stop responding to orders.

[[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]]Oathgold is a precious ore gathered by the [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]] to bind the Winds of Magic, used primarily to [[sl:campaign_forging_magic_items]]forge[[/sl]] magic [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]].
The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Dark Magic is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.

Hills and other [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] features that block line-of-sight can be used to conceal [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] from the enemy. An [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] must have line-of-sight to an enemy in order for it to be visible.
Receive [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves||When [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves are captured in battle, this province will receive its normal share.
Foreign Slot Building Complete
Select an army on the Forces drop-down list to zoom to it and open its Army panel.

[[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]Recruitment[[/sl]] of new [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], the upkeep of existing units and the construction of [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] all deplete Dark Magic.
Amber
Research the following technology:
Amanar

[[url:script_link_campaign_elven_council]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Elven Council[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\nA variety of benefits may be gained by appointing [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords to the Elven Council.
Confederation
Capture Points
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_fortifications_link]]Fortifications[[/sl_tooltip]]
Flanking
Set brayherd target

The more warbands you field, the harder it becomes to maintain them all. As supply lines become more complex, gold and supplies will ‘go missing’ -  the chieftains having little idea where they may have gone...
A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord may be removed from a position by clicking the Remove from Office button on the Offices panel.
Crushing the incursion will not solve the underlying [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} problem, which must be tackled separately.

The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. The vermin think to rob us of our vengeance and to claim the Vortex before you. They must be purged from hated Ulthuan. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

The most infamous pirates may seize [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]], which can be used to defeat [[sl:campaign_amanar]]Amanar[[/sl]] in the Eye of the Vortex campaign.
Pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords may be appointed to positions of [[sl:campaign_fleet_office]]Fleet Office[[/sl]] to grant them extra authority and bonuses.
Pirates may upgrade their ships at sea, and construct [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_pirate_coves]]Pirate Coves[[/sl]] in enemy [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]ports.

Undead pirates spread [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_corruption]]Vampiric corruption[[/sl]] where they settle. Vampires will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] when moving through land areas not afflicted by Vampiric corruption.
Vampiric pirates can [[sl:campaign_raising_dead]]raise the dead[[/sl]], allowing them to quickly build massive armies.
Quell Animosity||Bash the mob's heads together in order to restore some [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness to the army. This will cause some casualties.
Victory points behave much like [[sl:battle_capture_points]]capture points[[/sl]], and are attacked and defended in the same manner.
Once a victory point is taken the attacker does not immediately win. Instead, a timer begins to count down.
Once this timer reaches zero, the attacker wins. The defender may interrupt the countdown by retaking the victory point.
The victory point icon can be viewed at all times on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] during a siege battle.

[[url:script_link_campaign_black_arks]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Black Arks[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Unlike others among his Dark Elf kin, Lokhir Fellheart may summon a mighty Black Ark after occupying a major [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port; as more are acquired, the number of Black Arks available for recruitment will increase accordingly. These powerful floating fortresses can be used to raise armies, recruit units, and support invasion forces with aerial bombardments.

[[url:script_link_campaign_rites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Rites[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The Rite of Anath Raema exclusively benefits Lokhir’s faction by improving the stats and attributes of naval units such as Black Ark Corsairs and the Kharibdyss.

[[url:script_link_campaign_slaves]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Slaves[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Dark Elf factions capture [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves in battle, which provide additional [[img:icon_income]][[/img]]income, but can negatively affect [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order. [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]Slaves can be sacrificed to perform rites.

Learn more about Dark Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_elves]]here[[/url]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_books_of_nagash]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Books of Nagash[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Within the Black Pyramid a great power lies dormant, waiting to be unlocked by the bearer of the nine Books of Nagash.

Collect the Books of Nagash and win the Battle for the Black Pyramid to achieve this campaign's victory conditions.

[[url:script_link_campaign_day_of_awakening]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Day of Awakening[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb Kings factions can recruit units into their armies without the need to pay for their recruitment or upkeep. Instead, each unit has a limited initial recruitment capacity which can be increased by constructing additional buildings.

[[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Dynasties[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb King factions must delve into their past secrets to increase the number of armies or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes they can field, or to enlist the aid of mighty [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords from ancient dynasties.

[[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Mortuary Cult[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb Kings can spend their [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars within the Mortuary Cult, where Liche Priests combine them with [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade resources to craft magic items or awaken Legions of Legend - mighty warriors who can be recruited to battle.

Learn more about Tomb Kings [[url:script_link_campaign_tomb_kings]]here[[/url]].
Black Ark Building Panel
Task Select
extorted income
Blood! Slaughter! Blood!
Beware of [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]]raiding territory you control, as negative effects will be applied to your own province!

If [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] is high when a riot occurs then the incursion army may consist of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/skv]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]], or [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]vampiric[[/sl]] forces.
A battle is completed when all [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] on one side are routed or killed.

The forces panels display known forces including [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Cards[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_reinforcements]]reinforcements[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_banners_and_marks]]banners[[/sl]] and army effects.
Merciless

Asrai Lookouts are minor [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]]. Unlike other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]], Wood Elves may create Asrai Lookouts across the entire [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] by capturing settlements from rival [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]].
The Burghers control the trade.
The economy flows and so the treasury's coffers are filled... Well, those earnings that are declared anyway...
The Burgomeisters are a powerful force in the Empire and often a thorn in an emperor's side.
[[col:red]]You cannot construct this building before first constructing the prior building level.[[/col]]
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_commandments_link]]Commandments[[/sl_tooltip]]

The fog of war is lifted over an area of land when its central [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is captured, or if controlled by a [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]military ally[[/sl]].
The fog of war may be lifted over an area of [[sl:campaign_sea]]sea[[/sl]] by capturing a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]port[[/sl]] that controls it.

[[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] use [[sl:campaign_espionage]]espionage[[/sl]] to lift the fog of war over the territory of any [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] they [[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] with.
Waaagh!||Once this army's [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness reaches 80, and if the army has 17 units or more, a new Waaagh! army will emerge to lend a hand with the fightin'.

Each [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] exhibits a primary [[sl:campaign_character_traits]]trait[[/sl]] to which their [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] is inherently linked. Actions linked to the Lord’s trait must be performed or his or her loyalty will suffer.
Bonus Objectives||Completing a bonus objective does not grant an instant reward but instead increases the one received for accomplishing this chapter's primary objective.

The [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth of a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is a measure of the expansion of its population. [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth leads to [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, which can be spent on upgrading the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] within the province.
Unruly||If [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness drops below 40, with no one to fight, the boyz will fight each other and begin to suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.
This horde will grow over time and constructing appropriate buildings will help increase its rate of [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth.
Formations may be browsed by clicking the Formations button at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface.
Chapter Objective Issued!
The type of a unit is indicated at the bottom of its Unit Card.
A blood-curdling howl from way beyond the grave can stop an army dead in its tracks.
An incursion can be crushed straight away, but control gets higher while it gathers strength. This ensures that when you act, you are fighting all the foes involved.
Income from ship buildings:
The Mother Goddess, purity is her virtue. The tears she weeps for her children can cleanse the land of any taint.

The Dark Elves have enacted their final ritual. These lost servants have long since forgotten their original purpose and consort with Daemon-spawn. Their first generation marches on the Vortex, and will consume its power. This has been foreseen in the lost plaques of Tlanxla and it cannot be allowed. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Dark Elves from claiming victory!

The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. They have proven inadequate caretakers of the Great Vortex. It is time to merge the Great Warding and the Vortex once and for all, safeguarding the world for eternity. The Elf-spawn are too young, proud and self-assured to allow this. They shall be chastised for their own good and that of all creation. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the High Elves from claiming victory!
Shipbuilding Panel

The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. The nasty Toad-thing has transported his cohorts onto the dead isle - the Vortex is all but theirs. Failure of the great scheme is imminent! The Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the Reptile-things before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizard-things from claiming victory!
A missile unit's arc of fire is displayed when the cursor is placed over it.
Missile units will automatically fire at enemies within their arc of fire, unless the [[sl:battle_fire_at_will]]fire-at-will ability[[/sl]] is deactivated.
Missile units are generally lightly armoured and weak in hand-to-hand combat.
Missile units may use the [[sl:battle_skirmishing]]skirmish ability[[/sl]] to automatically retreat from an advancing enemy.
Selected missile units may be put into melee mode by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_melee_mode_button]]Melee Mode button[[/sl_tooltip]], forcing them to engage in hand-to-hand combat only.
Blood Voyage
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_reinforcements_link]]Reinforcements[[/sl_tooltip]]

[[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Skaven Under-Empire[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The Skaven can lurk beneath any settlement or ruin, growing their empire by either occupying regions or establishing [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities beneath them. Left undetected for too long, their malevolent scheming can result in hordes of vermin rising up to [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corrupt the land or assault illustrious cities without warning. Clan Skryre are also able to use any of their [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities to assemble a Doomsphere – a weapon of mass destruction with the potential to level an entire settlement.

[[url:script_link_campaign_forbidden_workshop]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Forbidden Workshop[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The Forbidden Workshop lets Clan Skryre go crazy with their ideas. By spending [[img:icon_warp_fuel]][[/img]]Warp-fuel and [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food, they can develop and upgrade the most powerful War Machines, Weapons Teams and weaponry known to Skavenkind, including devastating [[img:icon_doomrocket]][[/img]]Doomrockets.

[[url:script_link_campaign_food]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Food[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Skaven factions require a stockpile of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food, each army consuming an amount of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food per turn. [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]Food may be acquired from battles, by sacking settlements, and through certain buildings.

[[url:script_link_campaign_corruption]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Skaven Corruption[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The Skaven spread [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corruption wherever they settle, lowering [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order over time but giving additional uses of the [[url:script_link_campaign_the_menace_below]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_the_menace_below}}]]Menace Below[[/tooltip]][[/url]] army ability during battles fought within the local province.

Learn more about the Skaven [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven]]here[[/url]].
Left-click a spell button and then left-click the target to cast a spell.
Many spells may be overcast by left-clicking on the spell button a second time before casting.
An overcast spell has a greater effect, but also a chance of being miscast and dealing damage to the caster.
Some Wizards may be switched between different spell lores by clicking the buttons on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_lore_panel]]Lore panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
The tooltip on each spell button shows more information about that spell.

The {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]] shows information about [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term}}[[/sl]], [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]], and {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] for the player's faction.
The player faction’s ultimate [[sl:campaign_victory_conditions]]victory conditions[[/sl]] are displayed on the [[sl:campaign_objectives_panel]]Objectives panel[[/sl]].
Factions may engage in the research of [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] to improve their methods of warfare.
Various [[sl:campaign_faction_interfaces]]interface panels[[/sl]] exist to help the player manage their faction.
His devious, beastly nature is sure to catch the fickle eye of Tzeentch, no?
Quests
Advice history can be navigated using the [[sl_tooltip:battle_advice_history_buttons]]back and forwards button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the Advisor panel.
The level of advice can be reduced or minimised through the game options.
Advice history can be reset on the game options so that previously-seen advice will be shown again.
The Faction Summary button is shown next to the End Turn button on the campaign interface.
The Diplomacy button is shown next to the End Turn button on the campaign interface.

Large [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin armies[[/sl]] will enter a Waaagh! if their level of [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_fightiness]]fightiness[[/sl]] rises high enough. A large Waaagh! [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] will appear nearby and follow its host while the Waaagh! persists.
A book of the most savage and horrifying creatures in the world.

As your realm grows, you will require the aid of other Lords whose loyalty may be tied more strongly to their Clans, or who may have ancient debts of blood and gold to pay. In either case, they will serve those interests before allegiance to the High King – although they would never admit to such a thing!

[[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]Obedience in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is a measure of population happiness or repression, and must be [[sl:campaign_province_management]]kept in check[[/sl]] to prevent the province degenerating into [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Provincial growth[[/sl]] is a measure of population expansion. [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]Population surplus earned can be spent on upgrading a settlement to earn extra [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term_sentence_start}}[[/sl]] is a measure of local unrest. [[sl:campaign_revolts]]Rebellions[[/sl]] will occur if {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} drops too low.
Detailed information about a province can be found on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].
An incursion occurs if [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} in a province drops to -100.

[[sl:campaign_corruption]]Corruption[[/sl]] is a measure of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] interference, and could lead to an uprising if left unchecked.
If a faction controls an entire province it can issue beneficial [[sl:campaign_commandments]]commandments[[/sl]] there.
Battles
The colour of the ring surrounding the climate icon indicates its suitability for the race being played: green is suitable, yellow is neutral, red is unsuitable.
Climate type is indicated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_settlement_bars]]settlement bar[[/sl_tooltip]] that appears below each settlement on the campaign map.
The relative strengths of the forces involved are indicated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_balance_of_power_bar]]Balance of Power bar[[/sl_tooltip]].
Captives sacrificed:
Hero Actions
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_infamy_link]]Infamy[[/sl_tooltip]]
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_income_link]]Income[[/sl_tooltip]]
Incursions
Ambush Battles
Chivalry Gained!
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_armies_link]]Armies[[/sl_tooltip]]
Unrelenting
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_canopic_jars]]Canopic Jars[[/sl_tooltip]]

[[sl:battle_armies]]Army[[/sl]] commanders may arrange their [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] for the coming fight during the deployment phase of the battle. Once deployment is completed the battle begins.
No Mount

Missions may be issued from time to time to guide the progress of a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]]. They are optional to complete.

[[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] factions may build [[sl:campaign_asrai_lookouts]]Asrai Lookouts[[/sl]] anywhere on the campaign map.
The owner of each settlement is indicated by their faction icon here.\n\nThe ruin icon indicates that this settlement has no owner.

For thousands of years, the Dark Elves have plundered the riches of the world, using the blood and treasure of distant lands to fuel their war against the High Elves and others. Millions groan under the yoke of their slavery, or choke out their last on the altars of the Bloody-handed God. Under your dominion, the empire of malice reigns supreme!
Select next horde

The High Elves have stood guard over this world for millennia, defending it from the worshippers of unholy gods and the unthinking meddling of lesser races. Now, under your stewardship, the Glittering Hosts have beaten these foes into retreat or oblivion. An age of peace dawns, founded on the glory of the Elves!

Corruption affects [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}. The lower the level of corruption present in a province, the higher the [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} bonus will be. [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven corruption will spread over time after occupying settlements, resulting in a reduction in [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}.
Recruit selected [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero at the current horde.
[[col:yellow]]This Black Ark needs to be placed into the Dread Expansion stance in order to finish demolishing this building. Left-click to cancel the order.[[/col]]
Tomb Kings factions may only gain access to [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes through researching dynasties.
The Advisor button can be found in the top-left of the screen on the user interface.

A selection of [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may be grouped by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_group_button]]Group button[[/sl_tooltip]] so that they may be easily re-selected in future. Grouped units are arranged together under a tab on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
This resource may provide a unique building chain.
The information shown by the various drop-down lists may be sorted by clicking the column-header buttons on each list.

The most infamous pirates to sail the oceans are listed here, ranked by the level of [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy they have acquired. You can increase your [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy through actions such as killing enemy forces in battles, razing settlements, assassinating characters and establishing Pirate Coves.
Yet your empire is not bound by borders - yours spans the seas of the world. You top a hierarchy of infamy and power - your strength makes all those who traverse your waves tremble in fear.
The Forgotten Altar of Lake Capac
Pilferer
Factions may still sack a settlement they cannot occupy to gain [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]], or [[sl:campaign_razing]]raze[[/sl]] it to deny it to the enemy.
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_advisor_link]]Advisor[[/sl_tooltip]]

Yet your empire is not built from stones piled one upon another, on trade rooted in the sack of the land. Rather, it is the oldest empire of all; that of root and branch, leaf and bough. Its mighty hosts stretch unbroken from shore to shore once more, their deep roots anchoring the land, their song of triumph the whisper of leaves stirring in the breeze.
There is no limit to the number of basic skeleton units that may be recruited.

[[url:script_link_campaign_amber]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Amber[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\nThe Wood Elves gain [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber from quests, and from each settlement they or their allies hold. [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber may be spent on certain buildings, technologies, units, or on rejuvenating the Oak of Ages at the heart of Athel Loren.
A Wood Elf [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] can move through Worldroots by activating the Use Worldroots [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].
An army using the Worldroots stance will disappear from its original location and reappear at its destination.
The army must emerge from the Worldroots at the end of the movement phase, and so cannot traverse large, impassable gaps.
An army travelling through the Worldroots can be intercepted and brought to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] by a nearby enemy army, even one that cannot use the Worldroots.
Any available skill points for a selected character are shown on both the Character Info panel and the Character Details panel.

Greenskin [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] exhibit [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_fightiness]]fightiness[[/sl]], the level of which grows as the army engages in more [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]].
A Waaagh! will result if the [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness of a Greenskin army grows sufficiently.
Greenskin armies may make use of the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]].

Greenskin armies may construct [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Raidin' Camps by adopting the related [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]], allowing them to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raid[[/sl]] while in enemy territory.
Warherd Revealed
Only Avelorn is affected by Power of Nature.
Upgrading the main settlement building is usually the best way of increasing the size of the garrison army.
The Building Browser may be opened from the Province Overview panel or Building panel, and shows a list of all buildings that may be built in the selected province or horde army.
technologies.

Brayherd

A [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] may choose to raze a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] after defeating its defenders in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Razing a settlement burns it to the ground and leaves it abandoned.

[[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] that are [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]] from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] may rally and begin responding to orders again once they have retreated a safe distance from the enemy.
Waaagh! triggered!

Lord Mazdamundi is now fully roused and ready to enact his interpretation of the Great Plan. The spawnings are gathering at City of the Sun, for he senses a disturbance in the Geomantic Web surrounding Hexoatl, his capital. Communing telepathically with his fellow Slann, Mazdamundi learns of the invasion of his jungles by an army of tribal warmbloods.\nThe warmbloods in question are worshippers of the Ancient Enemy from the colony of Skeggi, notorious savages that dwell on the shores of the Lustria. Incited by the appearance of the comet, the Norse have launched an invasion of the Lustrian interior.
Settlements produce an additional [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison army[[/sl]] which will automatically defend it when attacked.
The [[sl:campaign_settlement_climates]]climate[[/sl]] of a settlement determines its suitability for occupation by a given [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_buildings]]Buildings[[/sl]] may be constructed within a settlement to boost its production or defences.
An enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may lay [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]] to a settlement in an effort to capture it.
The ruling [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] may position an army in a settlement to defend it from attack.

Followers of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], such as the [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] and the [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]], erect artefacts of worship to the Ruinous Powers in [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] that they [[sl:campaign_razing]]raze[[/sl]]. These spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] to nearby settlements.
Ephemeral defences cannot protect the enemies of Unlife from its most committed adherents.
The attacker may begin the capturing process by clearing the defenders out of a capture point and positioning a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] within it.
The capture process takes a short time. A capture point is taken once the defender’s flag is run down the central flagpole and the attacker’s flag is run up.
The capture process may be interrupted by the defender counter-attacking. The defender may also retake a capture point.
[[sl:battle_victory_points]]Victory points[[/sl]] behave like capture points but determine control of the entire settlement.

Intervention armies may be hired by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_interventions_button]]Interventions button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_rituals_bar]]Rituals bar[[/sl]] while a rival [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] is conducting a [[sl:campaign_rituals]]ritual[[/sl]].

Intervention armies cost {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to hire. The more {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] spent, the greater the military power of the army that appears.
Intervention armies do not operate under the direct control of the summoning faction, but will instead act autonomously to achieve their objective.
The size of the intervention army is chosen on the panel that appears when the interventions button is clicked.

These icons represent buildings within the settlements in the province.\n\nThe first icon within each settlement represents the settlement building, upgrades to which affect the settlement as a whole.

That which is sacrosanct has been preserved. That which is sublime has been protected. That which threatened has been destroyed. Your name and deeds of heroism will be remembered always. For Bretonnia, and for the Lady!

The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. The Rat-spawn are abominations that should never have existed in the first place – that they now come in reach of the Great Vortex is the greatest of all crimes against the Old Ones. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

The [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness of a Greenskin army decreases slowly over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]]. If it gets too low, the troops will get restless and start fighting each other, causing casualties.

No sooner has Malekith issued his commandment to Felicion than word reaches him that Naggarond is under attack. A treacherous band of Skaven and their Marauder allies have taken advantage of the discord wrought by the comet's appearance to strike at the Dark Elf heartland.\nCursing the perfidious ratmen, Malekith gathers his retinue and hurries back to the shore to mete out their punishment in person.
Examine the tooltip on each engagement button to view more information about that option.
The relative strengths of the forces involved are indicated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_balance_of_power_bar]]Balance of Power bar[[/sl_tooltip]].
Click the attack button to contest the [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] in person, or the withdraw button to retreat if the odds are unfavourable.
The [[sl:campaign_autoresolving]]auto-resolve[[/sl]] option may be selected to have the outcome of the battle determined automatically.
If the battle is being fought at a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] then [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]] options will be displayed.
The {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury value is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
The Unit Info panel can be switched between showing a description of the selected unit or a breakdown of its core strengths and weaknesses by clicking the toggle button on the panel.
Certain bonuses can speed up the rate at which technology research is carried out. The cumulative effect of these bonuses is shown in the top-left of the Technology panel.

You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your enemies, and stop the High Elves from claiming victory!

[[img:icon_blood_kiss]][[/img]]Blood Kisses are shown at the top of the campaign interface. They may be earned through the killing of important enemy [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]].

Once earned, [[img:icon_blood_kiss]][[/img]]Blood Kisses may be spent on the Bloodlines panel to awaken a Bloodline. Doing so unlocks a powerful ancient [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord for recruitment from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Awakening a Bloodline also earns other bonuses, which may be seen by placing the mouse cursor over the skull icons on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_bloodlines_panel]]Bloodlines panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Each Bloodline may be awakened multiple times to earn greater bonuses.
Only the [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire Counts[[/sl]] of Sylvania may awaken Bloodlines.

A Black Ark can be made available for recruitment by performing the Sacrifice to Mathlann [[sl:campaign_rites]]rite[[/sl]] or occupying a major [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port when playing as Lokhir Fellheart.

Once available, the Black Ark may be recruited by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_recruit_black_ark_button]]Recruit Black Ark button[[/sl_tooltip]], which appears on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview Panel[[/sl]] when a controlled [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]port[[/sl]] is selected.

Black Arks are best used in support of a foreign invasion force. Armies of the same [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] within their sphere of influence will [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]]replenish any casualties and may [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit new units[[/sl]].
Dark Elf factions may also [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]raise armies[[/sl]] from Black Arks.

Dark Elf armies which engage their enemies within the bombardment range of a Black Ark will gain the supporting bombardment army ability in battle. This bombardment range is shown on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] when the Black Ark is selected.

The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. Their cold-blooded armies arrive on the Isle of the Dead to claim the Great Vortex - the prize that is rightfully yours. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizardmen from claiming victory!

If the proportion of any one type of corruption exceeds 50% in a province then the effects of that corruption will begin to apply.

Factions can use [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]], construct certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], or deploy [[img:icon_general]][[/sl]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] with certain [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skills[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_character_details]]followers[[/sl]], to modify corruption in their provinces to their own taste.
[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Heroic actions[[/sl]] may be used to increase or decrease corruption in a foreign province and destabilise it prior to invasion.

If [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} drops too low in a corrupted province then a [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]vampiric, [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos or [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven uprising will occur in place of a standard [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]].
Corruption will spread from settlement to settlement over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_ship_building]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Pirate Crews & Shipbuilding[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Enlist and expand your crew via pirate settlements or from your Legendary Lord's flagship. Your Lord operates as a mobile fighting and construction platform, independent from normal empire-building and able to recruit or construct from their flagship at sea or on land without the need of a settlement.

[[url:script_link_campaign_infamy]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Infamy[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
To become a legendary pirate, you must first acquire [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy through your actions. Defeating armies, capturing settlements and establishing [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves will increase [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy levels.

In doing so, your ranking on the list of infamous pirates will improve, rising towards the top and drawing the attention of legendary pirates in possession of the powerful [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the Lost Sea Shanty.

[[url:script_link_campaign_pirate_coves]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Pirate Coves[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
[[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves can provide a steady [[img:icon_income]][[/img]]income and other benefits from settlements owned by other factions.

These [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]coves can be secretly developed at any [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port settlement, leeching from the current occupants though they will be blissfully unaware of your activities.

Learn more about the Vampire Coast [[url:script_link_campaign_vampire_coast]]here[[/url]].

Factions are tribes, peoples or nations on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] that control [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], amass [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and make [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] with one another. The Warriors of Chaos seek nothing but to sow destruction amongst the mortal [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] in service to their Dark Gods. Their vast [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], headed by the mightiest Champions of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], march south from the frozen wastes to slaughter and destroy.

Roads that cross the landscape usually provide the fastest and safest method of travel.

Some [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] can use the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]], [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_beast_paths]]beast-paths[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]] to cross impassable areas.

First of the Slann Mage-Priests spawned upon the world, Venerable Lord Kroak may be awoken by any and all of the Children of the Old Ones to witness and command his near unimaginable power in turning cities of the world to ruin.

[[url:script_link_campaign_geomantic_web]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Geomantic Web[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Lizardmen settlements are linked by an unseen network of power which spans the world. By increasing the power of the Geomantic Web in a province, a Lizardmen faction can increase the potency of any commandments issued there.

The attacker in a siege battle can use siege weapons to target areas on the walls or the gate.
The defender in a siege battle may position selected [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] on top of the walls by right-clicking.
The defender must place units next to siege towers to control them, so that they may fire upon the enemy.
The missile fire of a controlled tower may be directed by left-clicking the icon above the tower and right-clicking the desired target.
Towers and gates may be captured or recaptured by taking control of the associated [[sl:battle_capture_points]]capture point[[/sl]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_influence]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Influence[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
High Elf factions gain [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence as political events fall in their favour, which may be spent on court intrigues and on recruiting more powerful [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes.

[[url:script_link_campaign_intrigue_at_the_court]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Intrigue at the Court[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
High Elves can spend their [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence on Intrigues at the Court - whispered deals in the halls of power that pull strings to improve or worsen the diplomatic relations between factions.

[[url:script_link_campaign_espionage]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Espionage[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
High Elves use [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements to spy on their partners. High Elf factions have full visibility over the territory of any faction they trade with.

The Dark Elves have enacted their final ritual. Victory is in their grasp, and failure is in yours! If the Witch King-thing takes the Vortex, the Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the nasty Elves before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Elf-things from claiming victory!

The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. Soon they will reclaim the Vortex. Failure of the great scheme is imminent. The Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the Elf-things before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Elf-things from claiming victory!

Mounted troops are highly [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]manoeuvrable[[/sl]], but generally more expensive and fewer in number than [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]].

A mounted charge can impart a big [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership[[/sl]] shock to an enemy, particularly if delivered to the [[sl:battle_flanking]]flank[[/sl]] or rear of an enemy unit.
Mounted troops are useful for picking off weak or isolated units.
Mounted troops are vulnerable against [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]spear weapons[[/sl]] or in prolonged engagements.
All factions can potentially wield the Sword of Khaine.

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] may be recruited in service of a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_recruit_hero_panel]]Hero Recruitment Panel[[/sl]]. A Hero may perform [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]actions[[/sl]] that strengthen the faction's [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], or to strike against enemy targets.

Certain [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] roam the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] as hordes. Horde factions do not inhabit [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], instead carrying their infrastructure with their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]].
The Slaves buttons are only shown when playing as a Dark Elf faction.

Skaven are treacherous by nature and [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of this [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] exhibit varying [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] to their masters. The loyalty of Skaven [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords must be kept in check to prevent them rebelling and forming a new [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
Sacrifice of Amaxon\n\n[[col:green]]Unlocks a random Follower
Khorne's Rage
The Grudges button is shown on the user interface when playing as Dwarfs.

The Norscans are a [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] of tough and warlike men, shaped both by the harsh conditions of the north and living dangerously close to the Chaos Wastes. They worship the forces of the Gods - personified as the Hound, the Crow, the Serpent and the Eagle - raising dark shrines and making bloody offerings to the Ruinous Powers.
[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] exert zones of control around them, through which an enemy army cannot pass except to attack the owner.
Island & Black Ark Battles
Errantry War Successful!

The pirates of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] ply the waves in their search for [[sl:campaign_treasure_maps]]Treasure Maps[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_pieces_of_eight]]Pieces of Eight[[/sl]] and verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_encounters_at_sea]]Encounters at sea[[/sl]] occasionally provide opportunity to extract plunder from the waves.
Armies may cross from the land to the sea at a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port or on a beach, but not over a rocky cliff.
Areas of the sea too far from the coast will cause [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional[[/sl]] casualties in any armies unlucky enough to stray into them.
[[sl:campaign_armies_at_sea]]Armies at sea[[/sl]] are slow and highly vulnerable to attack. Battles fought at sea will be contested on islands.
Murderous Prowess
Reinforcements may take time to appear, during which the army being reinforced is at risk of being defeated in detail.

Buttons to open the [[sl:campaign_technology_panel]]Technology panel[[/sl]], {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_objectives_panel]]Objectives panel[[/sl]] and more are shown next to the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_end_turn_button]]End Turn button[[/sl_tooltip]].

[[sl:campaign_drop_down_lists]]Drop-Down lists[[/sl]] summarise useful information for the player about controlled forces, [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] and other known [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]].
The [[sl:campaign_strategic_map]]Strategic Map[[/sl]] shows a view of the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can be used to plan moves.

The [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview Panel[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info Panels[[/sl]] show information about a selected settlement and the [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] that contains it.
The [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] shows information about a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]].
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_gods_link]]Allegiance to the Gods[[/sl_tooltip]]

For each settlement you control your armies can sustain an additional {{tr:peasants_per_region}} [[img:bullet_brt_peasants]][[/img]]peasant units, with your capital being able to sustain {{tr:peasants_capital}}.\nWhen [[img:bullet_brt_peasants]][[/img]]peasants are recruited they cannot continue working their farms. As such, farming [[img:icon_income]][[/img]]income will decline should you recruit beyond your capacity.
Infantry [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are dense formations of men armed with hand-to-hand weapons. Massed ranks of infantry are the mainstay of most [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] compositions.

Amongst [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]], the rulers of Nagarythe place a singular importance on striking at the opposition's nobility. Bonuses will be earned by Nagarythe when those enemy [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] marked for death are killed in battle or campaign.

The Post-Battle panel appears after a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] has been fought, and presents [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]options[[/sl]] for what to do with the spoils if victory was achieved.

Orders are given to units in an army, not individual soldiers.
Each unit in the player’s army is represented by a [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]]. These are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
One or more armies fight on each side in a battle.
An army is always led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lord[[/sl]].
An army may be [[sl:battle_reinforcements]]reinforced[[/sl]] by additional units or armies coming onto the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] during the fighting.

Characters gain followers, [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]], [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl_tooltip]], [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank and skills[[/sl]] over time as they perform actions.

The Faction Summary screen shows information and statistics about the player’s [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], along with a historical record of important events that have happened in the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]] so far.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may lie in wait for its enemies by entering [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]]Ambush [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]], in which it will remain hidden to enemy armies until they wander into the trap.

[[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]Diplomacy[[/sl]] is conducted on the Diplomacy screen, which may be opened at any time by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_button]]Diplomacy button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the user interface.

Ulthuan, the island home of the [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]], is divided by a ring of mountains between outer and inner [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
More significant penalties will be suffered by Avelorn should any Fortress Gate or inner ring settlements fall to a non-High Elf faction.
Avelorn will suffer minor penalties should any settlement in the outer ring of Ulthuan be captured by a non-High Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
The territorial integrity of Ulthuan can be seen on the campaign interface when playing as Avelorn.
Conversely, Avelorn and its leader, Alarielle, will receive a variety of bonuses should all of Ulthuan belong to the High Elves.
The most prevalent corruption type in a foreign settlement is shown on the Settlement Details bar that appears when the settlement is selected.
I don't just throw a spanner in the works, but the wrench and the whole Taal-damned toolbox as well!
In order to research this technology, this amount will be deducted from your total supply of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber.
An army can retreat when offered battle, but it can only do this once per-turn.
Highly-skilled in the ignoble art of indiscriminate violence, this one is eager to demonstrate his talents at every given opportunity.

A [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] will feel the effects of bankruptcy should it run out of {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]]. Troops that go unpaid will begin to desert their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]].

The {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury value and {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income per-turn[[/sl]] are shown on the campaign interface.
A faction with an empty {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury and a negative {{tr:icon_income}}income is considered bankrupt.

Restore a positive {{tr:icon_income}}income by [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]disbanding units[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term_plural}}[[/sl]], establishing [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] the enemy.

Savage hybrids of human and animal, the primal, barbarous Beastmen strike out from deep within the dark forests of the Old World. They strive to serve the gods of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] and to reduce the civilised [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] to madness and ruin.

Dark Magic is unique -  the greater its concentration, the more Dark Magic will be drawn to it. If the Winds of Dhar are shared between powerful Vampires and Necromancers, however, Dark Magic becomes more difficult to accumulate -  their Undead legions requiring more energy to remain bound.
Assault Units
Ritual buttons are shown in sequence along the Rituals bar.
Each time a character increases in rank, they gain a skill point to spend. Unspent skill points are shown here.
Merged units keep their [[sl:campaign_unit_experience]]experience[[/sl]] and are less likely to be wiped out in further [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]].
A unit may be disbanded to save on upkeep costs.
Similar units that have suffered casualties in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] may be merged together by selecting both Unit Cards and clicking the merge option.

The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. The cohorts of Lord Mazdamundi have invaded Ulthuan – they wish to control the Vortex, a creation of the Asur! Their goals are not the same as ours; the ancient Mage-Priest could easily decide to sink Ulthuan beneath the sea in order to permanently safeguard the Vortex. It has to be returned into the care of the High Elves. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizardmen from claiming victory!
Opportunity to Intercept
Mind Over Mind

Press CTRL + S within a campaign game to quickly save, or CTRL + L to quickly load the last saved game.

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] demonstrated by the  [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]] towards their masters varies as circumstances change. Their treachery must be kept in check to prevent them rebelling and forming a new [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
The Skirmish button is shown at the bottom of the screen when a unit that can skirmish is selected.
The location of each book may be seen by clicking the zoom-to button on the Books of Nagash panel.
A declaration of war on a faction may also result in war with that faction’s [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]allies.
A state of war will persist until one side is destroyed, or a peace deal is agreed through diplomacy.
Different victory types can be viewed by clicking the buttons down the left side of the Victory Conditions tab on the Objectives panel.
[[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elf[[/sl]] factions gain additional provincial {{tr:icon_income}}income from [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]].

The tax {{tr:icon_income}}income from all controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

A province may be excluded from paying tax on the Province Info panel to improve [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] there.

Taxed {{tr:icon_income}}income is mainly generated by economic [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]]. The tax {{tr:icon_income}}income a building generates is shown when the cursor is placed over its icon on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
If a technology that’s not immediately available is selected for research then the game will automatically research the technologies that lead to it.
The horizontal marks on the [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]Fightiness bar show the thresholds of [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]Fightiness at which army behaviour will change.

Wood Elves may expand anywhere on the campaign map by capturing enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] and constructing [[sl:campaign_asrai_lookouts]]Asrai Lookouts[[/sl]].

Wood Elves can construct mighty [[sl:campaign_elven_halls]]Elven Halls[[/sl]] within Athel Loren, which contain more [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]] than even the largest settlements elsewhere.

Wood Elves earn pieces of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_amber]]Amber[[/sl]] as they capture settlements. [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber can be spent on improving the [[sl:campaign_oak_of_ages]]Oak of Ages[[/sl]], which the Wood Elves must nurture in order to achieve [[sl:campaign_victory_conditions]]victory[[/sl]].
Wood Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] may move via the [[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]] to travel under otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].

A variety of benefits may be gained by appointing [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the Wood Elves to either the [[sl:campaign_elven_council]]Elven Council[[/sl]] or the [[sl:campaign_gathering_of_the_ancients]]Gathering of the Ancients[[/sl]].

There are a variety of more advanced methods for issuing instructions to selected [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] once [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]basic manoeuvring[[/sl]] is learned. Use the cursor keys to nudge [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]] units into position, for example.

Faction may engage in [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]] with one another, and can even [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl]] with other factions of the same [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] if conditions are right.
Available skill points are also shown on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].
Recruiting switches the army into muster or [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Encamp stance. If these stances are unavailable then so is recruitment.

The [[sl:campaign_mortuary_cult]]Mortuary Cult[[/sl]] may be used by the Tomb Kings to craft magic [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]] and unlock [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]].

Tomb Kings [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] may collect [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_canopic_jars]]Canopic Jars[[/sl]] from victory in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. These are consumed by the Mortuary Cult, by performing [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]], and by researching certain [[sl:campaign_dynasties]]Dynasty technologies[[/sl]].

Dynasties may be [[sl:campaign_technology]]researched[[/sl]] in order to increase the number and variety of [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] a Tomb Kings faction may [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]recruit[[/sl]].

Tomb King units are [[sl:campaign_day_of_awakening]]awakened[[/sl]], and do not cost [[sl:campaign_money]][[img:icon_money]][[/img]]money[[/sl]] to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] or maintain.
In the Eye of the Vortex campaign, the Tomb Kings must seek out [[sl:campaign_books_of_nagash]]Books of Nagash[[/sl]] in order to achieve [[sl:campaign_victory_conditions]]victory[[/sl]].
Siege panel\nThe Siege panel is displayed when a settlement is placed under siege, showing options and, if the settlement is fortified, allowing siege weapons to be built prior to battle.

Hailing from deep within the jungles of Lustria, the cold-blooded Lizardmen are the most ancient [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] of all. They are comprised of multiple species – the agile Skinks, the monstrous Kroxigor, the warlike Saurus, and the contemplative Slann, who lead the Lizardmen with their matchless wisdom and command over the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]].
Select an army to show the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]], on which Unit Cards are displayed.
The number of men in a unit and the unit's [[sl:campaign_unit_experience]]experience level[[/sl]] are shown at the top of its Unit Card.
A unit’s [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]type[[/sl]] is indicated at the bottom of its Unit Card.

Left-clicking a card shows a rollout displaying options such as [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]merging and disbanding[[/sl]]. Multiple cards may be selected by clicking while holding down Shift or CTRL.

Ships may be upgraded from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_ship_building_link]]Building panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when an eligible Legendary Lord is selected.
[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Growth[[/sl]] points are earned by fleets eligible for shipbuilding, and may be spent on upgrades.

The [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_bestial_rage]]bestial rage[[/sl]] of a Beastmen [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] increases as it fights [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], and a [[sl:campaign_brayherds]]brayherd[[/sl]] will result if it grows sufficiently.
An army moving through the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway will disappear from its original location and reappear at its destination.

[[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] use [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade agreements[[/sl]] to spy on their partners. High Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] have full [[sl:campaign_fog_of_war]]visibility[[/sl]] over the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] territory of any faction they have agreed [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade with.

The [[sl:campaign_sea]]oceans[[/sl]] sometimes throw up chance encounters, such as wrecked vessels or shifting islands. [[sl:campaign_armies_at_sea]]Armies at sea[[/sl]], close to such encounters, may be able to extract plunder from them.

In Karaks reclaimed according to the oaths laid down in the Great Book of Grudges, and in countless other mining colonies, trading posts, villages and great cities across the world, your people throng the halls in celebration, and many a horn of ale is raised on high to join the drinking songs and the fierce voices crying "Vengeance is ours!"
Those sacrificed to the Lady of Desire go willingly to their deaths. Such appeasement enthrals the masses.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may attack foreign armies or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], leading to [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] between the [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] involved. Instruct a selected army to attack a target by right-clicking on it.

Beastmen armies may hide by entering Hidden Encampment [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]], and have a chance to [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ambushes]]ambush[[/sl]] even when attacking normally.
An army can move into the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway by activating the Use Underway [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].
Infantry units are often heavily armed and armoured, but are generally slow and vulnerable to being [[sl:battle_missile_units]]outranged[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]outmanoeuvred[[/sl]].
Highly-skilled in the ignoble art of indiscriminate violence, this one is eager to demonstrate his talents at every given opportunity.

[[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] corruption is spread wherever the Skaven settle. As they naturally befoul anywhere they linger, [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] causes settled [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] to become less hospitable over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]], even for Skaven.
Lucky Git!
The Victory Conditions tab shows victory conditions on the Objectives panel.

[[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elf[[/sl]] society is hierarchical in nature, and courtiers watch for any opportunity to gain in status at the expense of their peers. The [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence of a High Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] grows as events fall in their favour, and this [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence may later be spent on [[sl:campaign_intrigue_at_the_court]]court intrigues[[/sl]] and on recruiting [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]].
The balance of power between the opposing forces is shown here. The bar updates throughout the battle.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may engage in diplomacy with one another. Diplomatic actions include declarations of [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] and peace, [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] agreements, [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliances[[/sl]] and more.
One or more units may be [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]] at any time. [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]Movement orders[[/sl]] are issued to all selected units.
More [[sl:battle_advanced_controls]]advanced control-methods[[/sl]] are also available to manoeuvre selected units.
Banners are displayed above units on the battlefield and indicate the unit’s [[sl:battle_unit_types]]type[[/sl]], strength and allegiance.
Unit behaviour is influenced by [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership[[/sl]] and [[sl:battle_vigour]]vigour[[/sl]] levels.
Some units have [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]] that can be used to turn the tide of battle.

If no second faction has been selected, the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_centre_panel]]central panel[[/sl_tooltip]] shows a list of known factions.

Powerful magic-users have mastered their art, so the Winds' bend to even the most subtle of requests.
Beastmen cannot inhabit [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], instead roaming the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]map[[/sl]] as [[sl:campaign_hordes]]hordes[[/sl]].
Infantry troops can carry a variety of [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]weapon types[[/sl]], such as swords, spears and axes.

Treasure Maps may be gained from victory in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_searching_ruins]]searching ruins[[/sl]], or from [[sl:campaign_encounters_at_sea]]Encounters at Sea[[/sl]].
The rough location of the buried treasure is shown on each Treasure Map. The exact location, always on land, is indicated by a riddle that must be solved.

Treasure may be searched for in a location using the Treasure Hunting [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]heroic action[[/sl]]. The treasure will only be uncovered if the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] is close enough to its hidden location to uncover it.
Active Treasure Hunts may be seen on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasure_maps_panel]]Treasure Hunts panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. A maximum of 6 treasure maps can be held at any given time.
Only the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords of the Vampire Coast may collect Treasure Maps.

Units cost [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]], and also require a further payment [[sl:campaign_turns]]per-turn[[/sl]] for upkeep.
Upkeep and other unit information can be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_unit_info_panel]]Unit Info panel[[/sl]].
Units may be [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]merged together or disbanded[[/sl]] from the Unit Card rollout, which appears when a Unit Card is selected.
Units depleted by [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] will slowly recover their numbers whilst in controlled or allied [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] appear in battle as units of one man.
The defenders of a settlement under siege will eventually starve and surrender unless they sally or are relieved by a [[sl:campaign_reinforcements]]reinforcing army[[/sl]].
The number of turns a besieged [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison[[/sl]] will hold out for is shown on its tooltip.

Province capitals are [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]]. It is required that these fortifications be reduced or circumvented for the besieger to storm the city in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]Siege weapons[[/sl]] are usually needed by the attacker to reduce any fortifications. These can be constructed on the [[sl:campaign_siege_panel]]Siege panel[[/sl]].
Coastal settlements contain special [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] that provide facilities for sea [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade.

A [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] that controls a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port may agree [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade with a faction they do not share a land border with, as long as that other faction also controls a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may transition between the land and the sea through a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port that it controls without incurring a [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]movement range[[/sl]] penalty.
