Initiating a Death Night also incites a [[sl:campaign_blood_voyage]]Blood Voyage[[/sl]], a murderous host that attacks Hellebron's enemies.
Capturing key locations on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]], such as the Shrine of Khaine, locks a level on the Death Night bar, preventing it from dropping too low.

A Death Night can be initiated by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_death_night_button]]Death Night button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface. This becomes active when a sufficient number of sacrificial [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]] have been acquired.
Basic controls for the player are listed [[sl:campaign_campaign_controls]]here[[/sl]].
The campaign game may be [[sl:campaign_saving_and_loading]]saved and loaded[[/sl]] from the game options.
The [[sl:campaign_advisor]]advisor[[/sl]] appears occasionally to render assistance.
Hellebron receives bonuses proportional to the current level of the Death Night bar. At the lowest level of the bar, these bonuses turn to penalties.
Initiating a Death Night fills the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_death_night_bar]]Death Night bar[[/sl_tooltip]] to its maximum level. The level of the Death Night bar drops as turns pass.
An army travelling through a beast-path can be intercepted and brought to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] by a nearby enemy army, even one that cannot use beast-paths.
A Beastmen [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] can move through beast-paths by activating the [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]]Use Beast-Paths [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].
An army using a beast-path will disappear from its original location and reappear at its destination.

Clan Skryre are known for their diabolical technological experiments, carried out in workshops beneath Skavenblight. The Forbidden Workshop is where Ikit Claw conducts his own personal experiments, upgrading Skryre’s Weapons Teams, Doomwheels and Doom-Flayers, and assembling [[img:icon_doomrocket]][[/img]]Doomrockets so powerful they can devastate enemy armies with their lethal strength.
The army must emerge from the beast-path at the end of the movement, and so cannot traverse large, impassable gaps.
The missions list appears below the campaign map radar on the interface.
If a [[sl:campaign_drop_down_lists]]drop-down list[[/sl]] is active then the missions list will be hidden.
Unused items may be recycled and turned into [[img:icon_oathgold]]Oathgold on the Recycle tab of The Forge panel; the amount gained depends on the rarity of the recycled item.
Forging items requires access to certain [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]]; those currently available are shown at the top right of The Forge panel.
Infantry units are usually best arranged in a line, so that each unit covers the flank of the next.
Items can be made on The Forge panel, which can be opened by clicking [[sl_tooltip:campaign_forging_magic_items_button]]The Forge button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.
The Technologies button is shown next to the End Turn button on the campaign interface.

Natural resources are to be found across the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. Ownership of the nearby [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] grants access to the resource, bringing in extra {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_trade]]trade income[[/sl]] to the controlling [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
The Regiments of Renown panel can be opened by selecting an army and clicking the dedicated button on the campaign interface.
Black Ark recruitment capacity||Each additional slot allows an extra unit to be recruited concurrently. Black Ark recruitment capacity can be increased with buildings.

The cursor tooltip over an area on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] shows the chance that an [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]]ambush will succeed there.
Provides opportunity to recruit fresh [[sl:campaign_units]]troops[[/sl]].
Double-click a faction to open negotiations. Once negotiations are started the central panel can be used to construct a diplomatic proposal.
Regimes cannot be maintained without strict discipline.
Zones of control allow an army to guard strategic positions on the [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]] such as a mountain pass or river crossing.
Killing targets marked for death is the main source of [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_influence]]influence[[/sl]] for Nagarythe.
A wise move, my lord, a severe aspect demands respect.
My word is law!
The attack option will become active when siege weapons are built, or when another method of overcoming the fortifications is available.
Siege weapons take some time to build, which is shown on their card in the construction queue.
Click an available siege weapon card to enqueue its construction.
Larger settlements with fortifications generally require siege weapons to be built prior to attack.
Small settlements without fortifications may be directly attacked or encircled in an attempt to starve the enemy out.

The men and monsters of the north have long sought to overthrow the civilisations of the south, but have always been thrown back to their frozen wastelands. But no more! Now, under your control, the Norscan hordes have been unleashed upon the Old World. The Chaos Gods gaze admiringly falls upon the leader of this cataclysmic event: you!

Positions of Office confer bonuses on the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords that occupy them.
The Menace Below is an army ability which allows Skaven factions to summon a unit of Clanrats anywhere on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] during a battle.

Anath Raema is the sister of Khaine, and Goddess of the Savage Hunt. Through her, the Dark Elves are gifted the joy of the chase and of the kill. Anath Raema does not care who or what is hunted; every living creature is prey to the bloodthirsty goddess!

Zones of control can be seen by placing the mouse cursor over an army or settlement.

An army travelling through the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway can be intercepted and brought to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] by an army above ground, even if that race cannot normally use the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway.

The research of [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] is undertaken on the Technology panel, which is launched by clicking the Technology button on the campaign interface.
The diplomacy attitude icons indicate one faction's standing towards another. The cursor tooltip on each icon gives more information about the relationship.

Unlock monster hunts through [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]].
The Bretonnian king will call an Errantry War as Bretonnian [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry increases, which must be won in order to achieve victory in the campaign.

The primary trait of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord of the Vampire Coast can be seen on the Details tab of the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]]. The tooltip on the trait indicates actions that will increase that [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty.
New units of infantry, cavalry or artillery can be recruited here.
The [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] and the [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] serve Chaos, and seek to spread its influence.

The influence of Chaos in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is measured as [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption. As [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] grows it will cause [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] to suffer and inflict [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] on non-Chaos [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]].
A Chaos uprising will occur if a [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]] happens in a province overtaken by Chaos corruption.

Chaos [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] cannot inhabit [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], instead roaming the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]map[[/sl]] as [[sl:campaign_hordes]]hordes[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Artefacts[[/sl]] are left behind in settlements [[sl:campaign_razing]]razed[[/sl]] by followers of Chaos. These spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption to nearby settlements.

Under your command, legions of the living have been relieved of the burden of life's struggle, and raised again into your eternal service. Those still permitted to cling to the misery of life are now as cattle, prey to the depraved hunger of your numberless dark servants, whose triumphant shrieks pierce the eternal night!

The Pre-Battle panel appears immediately prior to a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] engagement and provides [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_options]]options[[/sl]] and information about the strengths and setup of the [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] involved.

Complete monster hunt quests; locate these savage beasts before slaying them in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
With sufficient [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry, Bretonnian factions can summon the [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_green_knight]]Green Knight[[/sl]].

Information about [[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term}}[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] are displayed on the Province Info panel.
Any transient events affecting the province are shown in the Province Effects section.
Examine tooltips on the Province Info panel to see more detailed information about what is currently affecting the province.
Arrange [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]] units in a line so that each covers the flank of the next.
Dilemmas
A battle may be auto-resolved by selecting the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_autoresolve_button]]auto-resolve option[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]].
Battles fought as part of a [[sl:campaign_quests]]quest[[/sl]] cannot be auto-resolved.

Once the turn is ended, other [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] will then get the ability to move their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit units[[/sl]] and perform other actions.
Settlements become ruins when [[sl:campaign_razing]]razed[[/sl]] by an attacking force after a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
Settlements may be recolonised, but at a cost in both troops from the colonising army and in money.
Ruins may occasionally be [[sl:campaign_searching_ruins]]searched[[/sl]] for concealed treasure.

The forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] may use ruins to spread [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] to surrounding settlements by leaving a [[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Chaos artefact[[/sl]] there.
Siege weapons are manned by [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry units[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]], who are then able to push them towards enemy fortifications.
A selected infantry or missile [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] can be instructed to pick up siege equipment by right-clicking on it.

A [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]] unit can be ordered to drop an equipped siege weapon by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_drop_equipment_button]]Drop Siege Equipment button[[/sl_tooltip]].
A unit carrying siege equipment can be instructed to attack a section of the enemy fortifications by right-clicking.
Defenders may target siege weapons with [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missiles[[/sl]] to attempt to destroy them before they reach the walls.
Cycle of Rebirth
Objectives||View details of your chapter objective and your victory conditions.

Hold down the spacebar to view movement destinations. This also displays more information about visible units on their banners.
Right-click and drag out a formation on the battlefield to position selected troops accurately.
Use the R key to toggle units between running and walking. Use the Halt button or the Backspace key to order selected units to halt.
[[sl:campaign_quests]]Quests[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_grudges]]Grudges[[/sl]] and missions can be seen in the [[sl:campaign_missions_list]]Missions list[[/sl]].
Only Dwarf factions collect [[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]]Oathgold.
A unit will suffer a sudden drop to its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level if charged in the flank or rear. If the shock is great enough the unit may break and rout.

A Vampire Coast [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty may also be increased by sacrificing [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]post-battle loot[[/sl]], or by assigning them to a [[sl:campaign_fleet_office]]Fleet Office[[/sl]].
If a province [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebels[[/sl]] due to the effects of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption then a Chaos uprising will occur.
Waaaghs!
The enemy has moved to intercept your army as you move through the Underway. Prepare for battle!
{{tr:hp_battle_title_fire_at_will_link}}
An army on land may be [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]moved[[/sl]] onto the sea by selecting it and right-clicking the destination.

{{tr:icon_income}}Income to extort is mainly generated by economic [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]]. The {{tr:icon_income}}income a building generates is shown when the cursor is placed over its icon on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
An army switching between land and sea will not be able to move further on that [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]], unless they move through a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]port[[/sl]].

The {{tr:icon_income}}income extorted from all controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].
An army can only move between land and sea at a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port or on a beach, not on a rocky shore.

A province may be spared from extortion on the Province Info panel to improve [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] there.
Battles fought at sea will be contested on islands.
[[sl:campaign_encounters_at_sea]]Encounters at sea[[/sl]] occasionally provide opportunity to extract plunder from the waves.
Pirate coves established:

Some [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] can skirmish, whereby they automatically retreat when the enemy get too close. The skirmish ability may be toggled on a selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] with the [[sl_tooltip:battle_skirmish_button]]Skirmish button[[/sl_tooltip]].
Each [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] is led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord in battle, who leads and encourages the troops with many unique [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] of certain [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] may demand that another faction becomes its [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]]. A vassal faction is bound to its master and must follow it diplomatically.
Dark Elves capture [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]] in battle, who are then put to work in the mines of Naggaroth.
Dark Elf factions can sacrifice [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves to conduct [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] to gain powerful bonuses.
The Dark Elves can field mighty [[sl:campaign_black_arks]]Black Arks[[/sl]] at sea to support their foreign invasion forces.

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] of Dark Elf [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] to their leader cannot always be relied upon, and must be kept in check if they are not to rebel.

Different siege weapons are used to attack different parts of the settlement defences during [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
Rams are used to breach the gates, towers and ladders to scale the walls, and artillery can target both.
Siege weapons can take many turns to build, during which the attacking [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] must maintain the siege.

Artillery pieces and monstrous units also provide a means of overcoming fortifications. They may be recruited as [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] and travel with the army, negating the need for protracted sieges.
The Fire-at-Will button is shown at the bottom of the screen when a unit that can fire at will is selected.
This button opens the Character Details panel on the Details tab, showing a breakdown of information about the selected character.

The adoption of its robust oak aspect imbues the Branchwraith with the strength of the forest.

Island and Black Ark battles allow for combat at sea instead of auto-resolving. Both battle types play like land battles, with Black Arks giving the defender a slight height advantage in their deployment zone over the attacker.

The bar will fill as the player's army takes casualties.

When playing as a Dwarf faction, the current stockpile of [[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]]Oathgold is shown at the top of the campaign interface.
Each Lord or Hero may be joined by up to six followers and banners. Certain followers may only join Lords or Heroes, and banners may only be equipped by Lords.
Unused followers and banners may be assigned to other characters.

Followers may join your character and banners may be won in battle. Followers provide bonuses in campaign, whereas banners carried by a Lord may be assigned to that Lord's units to improve their performance in battle.
The [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire Counts[[/sl]] of Sylvania do not exhibit [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty.
The followers of Chaos can spread corruption by [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing settlements[[/sl]] and erecting [[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Chaos artefacts[[/sl]].

Provinces are large land areas on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] containing up to four [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]]. Control of a province can be split between multiple [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]], each [[sl:campaign_province_management]]ruling[[/sl]] over the settlements they hold.
Concerned
Inspect the enemy weapons, find their weaknesses... and exploit them.

[[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]Loyalty is a measure of the willingness of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] to follow the leader of his or her [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]]. Should a Lord’s loyalty reach 0 they will rebel, taking their [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] with them to form a new faction.
As the horde grows, its [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus can be used to make it stronger or to recruit new hordes.
Each [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]] in a selected army is represented on the Army panel by a Unit Card.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_unit_recruitment_button]]Recruit Units button[[/sl_tooltip]] opens the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Unit Recruitment panel[[/sl]] if [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] is available.
If the selected army belongs to another [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], the Army panel shows only known information.

If the selected army is a [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]] army and controlled by the player, the [[sl:campaign_building_panel]]Building panel[[/sl]] can be viewed by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_building_panel_tab]]Building Panel tab[[/sl_tooltip]].
The strength of the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] is indicated on the Army panel if the selected army contains a spellcaster.

[[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term_sentence_start}} in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is a measure of population happiness or repression, and must be [[sl:campaign_province_management]]kept in check[[/sl]] to prevent the province degenerating into [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]].

The trade tab on the {{tr:hp_campaign_treasury_panel_term}} shows information about available resources and [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trading partners and {{tr:icon_income}}income for the player's faction.

The higher the level of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry a Bretonnian faction attains, the greater the bonuses it receives. Conversely, penalties are suffered if their level of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry drops too low.
The defenders of a besieged settlement will begin to take attritional casualties after a number of turns, indicated here.
The defenders will eventually starve and surrender unless they sally out or are relieved by a reinforcing army. The turns remaining before this happens is indicated here.
The Strategic Overview shows a wider world-view, and may be used to assist with [[sl:campaign_faction_management]]faction management[[/sl]].
Layers on the Strategic Overview can be turned on and off with the various [[sl_tooltip:campaign_strategic_map_layer_buttons]]overlay buttons[[/sl_tooltip]] while holding the spacebar.

The battlefield is the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] on which the battle takes place. The edges of the battlefield are shown as white lines drawn on the battlefield when the [[sl:battle_camera_controls]]camera[[/sl]] is close.
Truly Terrifying
Mankind's most resourceful representatives know exactly how to hurt their adversaries.

Dark Elves perform worship to Khaine, the god of murder, through the shedding of blood on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]]. A Dark Elf [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] will receive favour in the form of increased combat performance should they kill enough enemies during battle.

[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] gain experience as they fight [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]]. More experienced units have higher [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership and fight more effectively.

Bretonnian factions earn [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry through certain actions in campaign, such as winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], and may be lost through unchivalrous actions such as [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]sacking[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] human [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].

Corruption in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

Battles are fought between [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] to conquer or defend territory. Battles are won by killing or routing all enemy [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], or by capturing the enemy settlement during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]].
Obtain and equip [[col:yellow]]followers[[/col]] here to improve your character, or attach [[col:yellow]]banners[[/col]] to units in their army before battle.

Any [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] requirements for recruiting a particular type of [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero are shown on these buttons.
The Recruit Hero panel can also be opened from the [[sl:campaign_building_panel]]Building panel[[/sl]] when a [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]] army is selected.

Peasant units recruited into service by a Bretonnian faction no longer contribute towards the economy.

[[sl:campaign_characters]]Characters[[/sl]] gain [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_magic_items]]items[[/sl_tooltip]] and develop [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]] as they perform successful actions. These can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
The Objectives button is shown next to the End Turn button on the campaign interface.

[[sl:campaign_tomb_kings]]Tomb Kings[[/sl]] factions awaken units they wish to field in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], and do not need to pay [[img:icon_money]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]] for their [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] or upkeep. The number of [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] of each type that may be fielded is determined by constructed military [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].

Certain Lizardmen [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may rampage when they take too much damage in battle. Rampaging units will continue to fight but will no longer respond to orders.

Ritual currency contains the knowledge and power required to conduct [[sl:campaign_rituals]]rituals[[/sl]]. [[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] require a certain amount of ritual currency to begin casting a ritual on the [[sl:campaign_great_vortex]]Great Vortex[[/sl]].

At the same time, however, she will gain substantial bonuses in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] when fighting large enemies fielded by the [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]], as well as more formidable [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] units.

Intrigues are initiated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_intrigue_at_the_court_panel]]Intrigue at the Court panel[[/sl_tooltip]], which is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_intrigue_at_the_court_button]]Intrigue at the Court button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.
Factions to be targeted may be selected from the dropdown lists on the Intrigue at the Court panel.
Choose to either improve or decrease relations between the selected factions. The cost in [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence is shown on the choice buttons.
Intrigues cost more to deploy if they are used repeatedly.

Move the camera with the W, A, S and D keys, or by holding the middle mouse button and dragging. Select [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] by left-clicking. Order selected armies to [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]move[[/sl]] or attack by right-clicking the destination or target.
Action-Reaction
At the current rate, there will be an incursion in the next turn or two!
The Creator, greatest upon the Mandala; his name alone can calm princes, tame courts and embolden all.

A faction can earn {{tr:icon_money}}{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}} through [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term}}[[/sl]], [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]], and certain military activities such as [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] and looting.

[[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]Recruitment[[/sl]] of new [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], the upkeep of existing units and the construction of [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] all deplete a faction’s {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury.

If a faction becomes [[sl:campaign_bankruptcy]]bankrupt[[/sl]] and is unable to pay its troops then its [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition in the form of desertions.
Consider [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]disbanding units[[/sl]] to compensate for negative {{tr:icon_income}}income.
The amount of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber currently held is shown at the top of the screen on the campaign interface when playing as Wood Elves.
Wood Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] lose [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber if they lose a settlement to the enemy.
Wood Elves may run a deficit of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber if they lose settlements, but they also experience negative effects while the deficit persists.
[[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber spent on units or buildings is returned if those units or buildings are lost or destroyed.
Only Wood Elf factions collect [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber.
Factions of a particular race receive a bonus to [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic[[/sl]] relations and therefore tend to stick together.

Rites may be browsed and initiated from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_rites_panel]]Rites panel[[/sl_tooltip]], which is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_rites_button]]Rites button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.
Factions of the same race may [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl]] if conditions between them are right.
Once used, rites are subject to a cooldown period before they can be used again.

Only certain races can form [[sl:campaign_hordes]]hordes[[/sl]], use [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]], employ special modes of travel such as the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]], use certain [[sl:campaign_stances]]stances[[/sl]], or make [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade agreements[[/sl]], for example.
The enemy has moved to intercept your army as you move through the beast-paths. Prepare for battle!
A Storm of Magic brews; let the enemy taste its might!
The End Turn button is displayed in the bottom-right of the campaign interface.

[[sl:campaign_buildings]]Buildings[[/sl]] within a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] may provide [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] to a garrison army that automatically defends the settlement from attack.

[[sl:campaign_buildings]]Buildings[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] are constructed in slots. New slots are unlocked in a settlement when the central settlement building is upgraded.
Man's Razed Settlements
The victims of Khaine cannot go meekly to His halls; it must be bloody-handed murder. But once the blood is flowing from whence will it stop?

For many generations, the dukes of Bretonnia have defended their lands from evil. The king calls an Errantry War whenever the lands of Bretonnia are threatened, bringing the dukes and their Knights together to drive out the invaders in the Lady’s [[sl:campaign_blessing_lady]]blessed[[/sl]] name.

[[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]Trade may only be agreed between two factions if their capital [[sl:campaign_settlements]]cities[[/sl]] are connected by roads or [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]Trade agreements are generally only agreed between factions where relations are good.
Detailed information about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade {{tr:icon_income}}income can be seen on the {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] factions cannot [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade.
[[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] use [[sl:campaign_espionage]]espionage[[/sl]] to gain visibility over the territory of those that they [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade with.

The [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] can establish their bases of operation in any [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]], including those owned by other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] where they can build [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities directly beneath them. Skaven settlements and [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities are part of the vast subterranean network connecting their strongholds known as the Under-Empire.
Followers, Gifts of Chaos & Banners

Hostile [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain types[[/sl]] such as snowy wastes, deep ocean, deserts and swamps will cause [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional casualties in any [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] that moves through them.

A new army may be [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]raised[[/sl]], and a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord appointed to lead it, on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s portrait is shown on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]] when the force they command is selected.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords appear in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] as powerful single-person [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lords within the player’s faction may go on [[sl:campaign_quests]]Quests[[/sl]] when they reach a sufficient [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]].

A brayherd [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] will appear nearby and follow its host while its level of [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage persists.

The Geomantic Web may be viewed by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_geomantic_web_button]]Geomantic Web button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface when playing as a Lizardmen faction. In this view, the colour of each Geomantic Web link and node indicates its operating power.
Certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] unique to the Lizardmen increase the potential power of the Geomantic Web in a province capital settlement.

The power of a Geomantic Web node is linked to the potential power provided by the buildings there, and the power of the nodes connected to it. A node must be linked to at least one other node of equal or higher power to operate at a given power level.
The province capital settlements of [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]allies[[/sl]] provide node links of a higher power than those controlled by unallied factions.

No Half-Measures

[[url:script_link_campaign_amanar]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Amanar[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Beneath the waves, an ancient beast stirs, having laid dormant for millennia. Many seek to kill it, while others wish to command its almighty strength for themselves.

Only through the use of an ancient sea shanty and a legendary weapon can you hope to fell the creature and satisfy this campaign’s victory conditions.

[[url:script_link_campaign_ship_building]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Pirate Crews & Shipbuilding[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Enlist and expand your crew via pirate settlements or from your Legendary Lord's flagship. Your Lord operates as a mobile fighting and construction platform, independent from normal empire-building and able to recruit or construct from their flagship at sea or on land without the need of a settlement.

[[url:script_link_campaign_infamy]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Infamy[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
To become a legendary pirate, you must first acquire [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy through your actions. Defeating armies, capturing settlements and establishing [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves will increase [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy levels.

In doing so, your ranking on the list of infamous pirates will improve, rising towards the top and drawing the attention of legendary pirates in possession of the powerful [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the Lost Sea Shanty needed for victory.

[[url:script_link_campaign_pirate_coves]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Pirate Coves[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
[[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves can provide a steady [[img:icon_income]][[/img]]income and other benefits from settlements owned by other factions.

These [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]coves can be secretly developed at any [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port settlement, leeching from the current occupants though they will be blissfully unaware of your activities.

Learn more about the Vampire Coast [[url:script_link_campaign_vampire_coast]]here[[/url]].
Imminent Rebellion!

[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Growth[[/sl]] causes [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus to accumulate in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]Population surplus can be spent on upgrading the central settlement building, which is always found in the first slot of a settlement.
Upgrading the settlement building opens new slots within the settlement, in which entirely new buildings may be constructed.
The cost in [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus of upgrading a settlement increases with the settlement size.
A settlement decreases in size when [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]sacked or occupied[[/sl]].

As a character increases in rank they are awarded skill points, which can be spent on improving and learning skills.

Characters can gain [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl_tooltip]] and [[sl:campaign_banners_and_marks]]banners[[/sl]] from victory in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. These can be equipped on the Character Details panel.
Magic items are shared across all characters in the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], but can be lost to other factions in battle.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Legendary Lords[[/sl]] may gain powerful items from [[sl:campaign_quests]]quests[[/sl]] which may not be lost or traded to other characters.
A character may also gain or lose followers as [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] progresses.

Information about owned settlements is displayed in full.

The host army must have at least 17 units for a brayherd to form.
A brayherd will follow its host army and engage enemies in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] unless instructed otherwise.
A brayherd may be assigned a separate target on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info Panel[[/sl]] when the host army is selected.
The brayherd will disperse when the [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage of the host army drops too low, or if the host army shrinks sufficiently.
The pool of units available to raise is replenished over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] within a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] can be appointed to the command of an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]]. Each army on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] is commanded by and contains one [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord.
Any [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional effects present in an area on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] can be seen on the tooltip shown when the cursor is held there.

[[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] armies will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional casualties when moving through areas not affected by [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampiric_corruption]]vampiric corruption[[/sl]], and vice-versa.

High levels of [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] will cause [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition in non-Chaos armies marching there.

The Chaos Wastes are territories at the extreme fringes of the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]], held by the forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]]. Only the [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] may pass through this area without suffering great losses.

Should a [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_plagues]]plague[[/sl]] spread to an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], all [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional casualties for the duration of the [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague.
Quarrelsome||If [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage drops below 20, the warherd's in-fighting will lead to severe [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.

[[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chivalry]]Chivalry levels[[/sl]] for Bretonnian [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] are increased by victories in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], and are affected by honourable and dishonourable acts. Greater levels of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry lead to greater faction-wide bonuses.

Bretonnian factions may draft [[sl:campaign_peasants]]peasants[[/sl]] from the land into their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]]. Drafting peasants will provide more [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] to fight in battles, but may cause {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] to suffer.
The [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_green_knight]]Green Knight[[/sl]], a renowned warrior of myth and legend, may be called to aid Bretonnian factions in times of great need.

Bretonnian [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] can partake of vows when they achieve a certain [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]], which greatly reduces upkeep on certain [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_5_chivalry}}
Waaagh!
Righteous Killer

Standard Skaven settlements are not ordinarily visible to other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]], appearing instead as uninhabited ruins. Skaven factions can always see each other’s settlements, but [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of other races will not discover the Skaven threat within a ruin until they attempt to colonise or [[sl:campaign_searching_ruins]]hunt for treasure[[/sl]] there.

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can perform an [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]action[[/sl]] on ruins to see if they are truly abandoned. Such scouting will reveal any hidden Skaven settlement.

To establish an [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City beneath a settlement owned by another race, the Skaven must either win a battle there and use the Expand Under-Empire post-battle option, or otherwise use Engineer [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes who can establish Under-Cities with limited frequentness using [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]agent actions[[/sl]].

The presence of an [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City may be detected if the Skaven expand it too quickly without concealment buildings or if measures are taken by the settlement owners to make it more detectable.

All Under-City buildings have a [[img:icon_discoverability]][[/img]]Discoverability effect; if the settlement owner above them has a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero in the region or constructs patrol buildings, this also increases the overall Discoverability of the [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City below, making it easier to be detected. Once the Discoverability threshold is crossed, the settlement owner will have the option to demolish the Under-City for an amount of gold.

Left undetected, the Skaven can scheme within their [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities in secret, eventually launching huge attacks upon the occupiers above by unleashing a Vermintide, or when playing as Clan Skryre, building a settlement-levelling Doomsphere.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may agree to trade with one another through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]]. A [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreement between two factions brings in additional {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] for both.

Once searched, a ruin will not yield further treasure for several [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]].
A puzzle must be solved before the ruin will yield its riches.
Attacking a ruin with an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] will offer the option of searching for treasure.
The presence of treasure is indicated by a golden glow over a ruined settlement.

Each race featured in the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]], such as the [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskins[[/sl]] or the [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]], carries certain racial traits which grant [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] of that race unique abilities or inabilities.

[[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]] earn [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber each time they capture an enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]], or from every settlement held by an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]ally[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber can be spent on constructing certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], researching certain [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]], recruiting certain [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], or to rejuvenate the [[sl:campaign_oak_of_ages]]Oak of Ages[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords may be removed from a position of office but doing so will cause their [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty to suffer.

[[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]Food can be gained from [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], by sacking [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], and from special buildings in [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] containing the Pastures [[sl:campaign_resources]]resource[[/sl]].
The [[sl:campaign_missions_list]]Missions list[[/sl]] shows active [[sl:campaign_quests]]Quests[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]], and [[sl:campaign_grudges]]Grudges[[/sl]].

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_forces_list]]Lords & Heroes list[[/sl_tooltip]] shows all [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] controlled by your faction at a glance.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_events_list]]Events list[[/sl_tooltip]] shows important notifications about your [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] or the wider world.
Left-click on a Unit Card on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] to pin the unit's information on the Unit Info panel.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_provinces_list]]Provinces[[/sl_tooltip]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_factions_list]]Factions lists[[/sl_tooltip]] summarise information about known [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] and factions.
Zoom in and out by scrolling the mousewheel, or by using the Z and X keys.
Rotate the camera with the Q and E keys.
Press ESC to access the game options.

Skilled Saboteur
Transferring too many units between hordes can lead to dissatisfaction.\n[[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]Bestial rage penalty to receiving horde:
The next victim revealed by Hekarti's scrolls on the ritual's enactment is even closer to the sorceress - the lover's lifeforce will taste bitter-sweet once the goblet is filled.

Bel Shanaar, the Explorer, the Phoenix King who sailed the Great Ocean and established colonies across the world. His summoning with this ritual will chart the course to the fourth shard of the Star Crown.
The final ritual is the most potent - the victim's lifeforce shall fill the goblet to its brim and when the Witch King drinks from it, he will walk into the Vortex and claim its power.
And so summon the very first Phoenix King. The one doomed to pull the Widowmaker from its stone plinth in the Shrine of Khaine. He is our greatest champion… and our greatest curse.
The second victim chosen by the ritual, whose lifeforce shall fill the goblet, is a hated foe: an Asur that the sorceress, Felicion, has tangled with in the past. It will be a joy to order her death.
Finubar, the reigning Phoenix King, is imbued with ritual power. He is the Seafarer and therefore the ocean will be his to command, for a moment at least.

The third name given is the sorceress' mentor. The victim was once one of great beauty with a dark heart, but she has not be seen in decades. She must be found and her lifeforce harvested on the ritual's completion.
The next ritual summons a Phoenix King of old: Bel-Korhadris, the Scholar-King. What secrets will he reveal on the ritual's conclusion that lead to the fourth shard of the Star Crown?
Lord Traits

The Oracle lurks on an isle off the poison shore. She will know what must be done, but to reach her, power must be wrenched from the Vortex. It will weaken and let the Ruinous Ones come, but they are no match for the Druchii!

A powerful spell of far-sight is cast over the Pool of Isha - in time the reflections on the pool shall reveal a path to follow. The Vortex shudders as ritual power surrounds and then weakens it; an unfortunate side effect, yet answers must be sought!
Post-Brayherd Blues

The weathered remnants of [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] long abandoned may be found the length and breadth of the campaign map. Yet in times of war they rarely stay untouched for long; hidden treasures and the possibility for territorial expansion draw many to their remains.
[[sl:campaign_battles]]Battles[[/sl]] involving the player can be auto-resolved so that the game automatically determines their outcome.

Millennia have passed since the Dark Elves, or Druchii in the Elven tongue, violently split from the [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]]. Banished from Ulthuan, the spiteful and wicked Dark Elves plot the demise of their former brethren from Naggaroth, their home continent. They have been ruled throughout their long history by Malekith, the Witch King.

The ancient Lizardmen's prophecies speak of the return to Lustria of the Serpent-God Sotek. The Cult of Sotek faction intend to see this prophecy fulfilled through [[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings and, of course, wiping the Skaven from their jungles. With each Sacrifice to Sotek, rewards of varying quality are given to Tehenhauin and his cohorts of Red Crested Skinks.

The Lost Sea Shanty grants use of a powerful army ability that can be used in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Additional [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the shanty increase the strength of this ability.

The gods of Chaos glory in slaughter and carnage. Their followers wage brutal [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] in their name, slaughtering in service to the Ruinous Powers. The mortal [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] must be ever-vigilant against threats of both Chaos invasion from abroad, and [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] from within.

Long before the rise of the younger races, the Lizardmen ruled supreme. After countless disasters and aeons of decline you have led them to the brink of success, finally enacting the unfinished plans of their long-lost cosmic masters!

[[col:help_page_link]]Master of the Skies[[/col]]
Tiktaq’to has access to a unique Rite called the Rite of Tzunki, this will grant additional action points to all armies and heroes across the Tlaqua faction for the turn in which it was used.

Additionally Skink Chiefs or Priests recruited by Tiktaq’to will be granted a Terradon to command by default.

[[url:script_link_campaign_lord_kroak]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Deliverer Of Itza [[/tooltip]][[/url]]
First of the Slann Mage-Priests spawned upon the world, Venerable Lord Kroak may be awoken by any and all of the Children of the Old Ones to witness and command his near unimaginable power in turning cities of the world to ruin.

[[url:script_link_campaign_geomantic_web]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Geomantic Web[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Lizardmen settlements are linked by an unseen network of power which spans the world. By increasing the power of the Geomantic Web in a province, a Lizardmen faction can increase the potency of any commandments issued there.

[[url:script_link_campaign_blessed_spawnings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Blessed Spawnings[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The spawning pools of Lustria will occasionally bring forth an especially gifted set of warriors, which may be recruited once a special mission is completed.

Learn more about Lizardmen [[url:script_link_campaign_lizardmen]]here[[/url]].
New armies can be raised and [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords appointed to lead them on the Recruit Lord panel.

Progress towards the next [[sl:campaign_rituals]]ritual[[/sl]], as well as the progress of rival [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]], is shown on the Rituals bar. The bar fills as [[sl:campaign_ritual_currency]]ritual currency[[/sl]] is earned, indicating progression in the race to control the [[sl:campaign_great_vortex]]Great Vortex[[/sl]].

The Lost Sea Shanty is separated into three [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses, each carried by a different pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]]. The current holder of each [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verse is shown on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_infamy_link]]Infamy list[[/sl_tooltip]].

They provide a method of attack against the [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]settlement fortifications[[/sl]], allowing the walls to be breached and the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] to be taken.
He may only be summoned a limited number of times by a faction during a [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign game[[/sl]].

Only [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] factions and [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]the Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] may take [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassals.

A [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal faction also pays its master a financial tribute each [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]]. Vassalage ends any [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] between the [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal and master.
A vassalage demand is only likely to succeed when the master is much more powerful than the [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal.

A faction may make another faction of the same race a [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal by capturing its last [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]], or through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]].
A [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal faction may break its vassalage agreement but this will lead to war with its former master.

Gain allegiance by [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] in the name of one of the four Gods or by completing [[sl:campaign_monsters]]Monster Hunts[[/sl]].

A [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]]non-aggression pact may be agreed between two [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] via [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]] as a statement of mutual trust. It is usually the first step in building relations towards [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] and, eventually, an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliance[[/sl]].

Siege weapons are large, constructed weapons of war that are used to attack the [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]] during [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battles[[/sl]]. Rams are used to breach the city gates, and siege towers are used to get troops on top of the city walls.

Settlements within a province produce [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term_plural}}[[/sl]] for the faction that controls them.
The settlements within a province may be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
More information about a province is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].
A faction that controls all settlements in a province may issue [[sl:campaign_commandments]]commandments[[/sl]] there.

Surviving on their wits alone, Waystalkers are equal parts taciturn, solitary and deadly. Their prey have little chance.

The Building panel can be viewed by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_building_panel_tab]]Building panel tab[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] when a horde [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] is selected.
Buildings available for construction can be seen by placing the mouse cursor over existing building icons.
The benefits a building brings are shown on its tooltip on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
The first [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]slot[[/sl]] in a settlement is reserved for the settlement building.
Military buildings specialise in allowing recruitment of new [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]unit types[[/sl]], improving recruited units, or in allowing more recruitment.
Defensive buildings specialise in providing [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison units[[/sl]] or improved [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]].

Economic buildings generate [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term_plural}}[[/sl]] or produce [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]], if available in the local [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]].
The current stockpile of [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars is shown at the top of the campaign interface when playing as a Tomb Kings [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] are subdivided into units of many individual soldiers. Units are represented by [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Cards[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] and elsewhere on the campaign interface.
Only Beastmen armies exhibit [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage.

Terrain features on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] can play a decisive role in any battle. Hills, mountains, forests and rivers can be used to [[sl:battle_visibility]]conceal troops[[/sl]] or funnel an enemy’s advance.

[[img:icon_port]][[/img]]Ports are [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] that adjoin the [[sl:campaign_sea]]sea[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]Trade[[/sl]] routes may be established from a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port across the water to distant shores.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may lay siege to an enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] over many [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]]. The defenders of a besieged settlement must sally forth or seek outside help to avoid starvation and defeat.
Losses incurred by a Blood Voyage army in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] will not be replenished.

[[img:icon_treasure_map]][[/img]] Maps that lead to buried treasure are highly prized amongst the pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]]. Great riches may be discovered by those who can solve the riddle of the maps.
The Power of Nature's representative visual effects on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] will diminish as its duration draws to a close.
The current duration of the Power of Nature bonus can be seen in the province's effects list.
The Known Factions list may be viewed by clicking the Known Factions button on the campaign interface.

If Alarielle begins her turn in a friendly province, bonuses are applied to [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]Untainted [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] for several turns.
Tooltips on the various [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action buttons show more information about that action, including its chance of success.
When issued, a commandment won’t apply its bonus until the [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] is ended.
Treasure Maps & Pieces of Eight||Collect maps to search for buried treasure or embark on voyages to track down pirates with the Pieces of Eight.
Deception

[[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves can be established in [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]] by factions of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] should they defeat the occupiers in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] or by [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves provide the pirate faction with {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] and other benefits despite the original occupant retaining control of the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].

A number of options are available to the victor after [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], such as killing any prisoners taken or looting a captured [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]]. These are presented on the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_panel]]Post-Battle panel[[/sl]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_sacrifice_to_sotek]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Sacrifices to Sotek [[/tooltip]][[/url]]
 As prophesied, Sotek’s coming will bring power and prosperity to the Children of the Old Ones. Only by following the instructions on the Plaque of Sotek, and by making great [[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings earned through battles, will Sotek truly reward those who follow him.

[[url:script_link_campaign_lord_kroak]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Deliverer Of Itza [[/tooltip]][[/url]]
First of the Slann Mage-Priests spawned into the world, Venerable Lord Kroak may be woken by any and all of the Children of the Old Ones to witness and direct his near unimaginable power in turning cities to ruin.

[[url:script_link_campaign_geomantic_web]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Geomantic Web[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Lizardmen settlements are linked by an unseen network which spans the world; by increasing the power of the Geomantic Web in a province a Lizardmen faction can increase the potency of any commandments issued there.

[[url:script_link_campaign_blessed_spawnings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Blessed Spawnings[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The spawning pools of Lustria will occasionally bring forth an especially gifted set of warriors, which may be recruited once a special mission has been completed.

Learn more about Lizardmen [[url:script_link_campaign_lizardmen]]here[[/url]].
[[col:red]]The settlement chain in this region cannot be built to a high enough tier to construct this building.[[/col]]
[[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars may also be consumed to enact [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] and to replenish [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] after a battle.
[[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]Alliance proposals are sent and received through the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]].
Significant diplomatic standing must be built up between two factions before an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance proposal is likely to succeed.

Diplomatic standing between factions may be improved by agreeing and sticking to [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]]non-aggression pacts and [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] agreements, or via diplomatic gifts.
An [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance may be broken by one party declining to join a conflict they would otherwise be compelled to enter.
Missile Units
Only the pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] may collect Pieces of Eight.

Magic-wielding Wizard [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may tap into the [[sl:battle_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] to cast powerful [[sl:battle_spells]]spells[[/sl]]. These spells can be used to empower allies or to sow destruction amongst the caster’s enemies.
The known locations of Pieces of Eight may be seen on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_pieces_of_eight_link]]Pieces of Eight panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Each Piece of Eight is connected to a unique [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiment of Renown[[/sl]].
Pieces of Eight may be secured by defeating [[sl:campaign_rogue_pirates]]Rogue Pirates[[/sl]] or completing certain [[sl:campaign_quests]]quests[[/sl]].
By securing one of the Pieces of Eight, the Regiment of Renown bound to it becomes available for recruitment.
The initiation of a new Death Night will result in the disbandment of any existing Blood Voyage army.
All [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes provide a constant passive effect whilst they are active on the campaign map. In some cases, this effect will be reversed when in enemy territory.
Ahh, a Champion of the God of Tricksters, Thieves and Gamblers if ever I saw one!
Any [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] may wield the Sword of Khaine, if they defeat the previous wielder in battle.
The occupying [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord will be granted the Sword of Khaine once it is drawn.

Only [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords of the [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]], the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]], or the [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]] may construct the Shrine of the Widowmaker building at the Shrine of Khaine, from which the Sword of Khaine is acquired.
Five books must be collected to gain control of the Black Pyramid and achieve [[sl:campaign_victory_conditions]]victory[[/sl]] within the Eye of the Vortex campaign.
Collected Books of Nagash may be viewed in the Books of Nagash panel.
Books may be held at certain [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], by [[sl:campaign_rogue_armies]]rogue armies[[/sl]], or in other locations.
Arkhan the Black starts with a single Book of Nagash unavailable to other Tomb Kings factions.
Trickery
Each Book of Nagash confers a powerful bonus on the owning [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
The Sword of Khaine may be found at the Shrine of Khaine, located off the north coast of Ulthuan.

[[sl:battle_infantry]]Infantry[[/sl]], [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]mounted units[[/sl]] and other types of [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] may bear different types of weapon in battle, each type being suited to different purposes.
Horde Growth
[[img:icon_income]][[/img]]
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_pre_battle_panel_link]]Pre-Battle Panel[[/sl_tooltip]]
Good-good! Further agenda of Arch Plaguelord Nurglitch, summon his agent-minion and let-let the choicest of plagues ravage the world.
Scouting

[[sl:battle_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] on the battlefield are made up of units of many individual soldiers. Each unit is independently controllable and represented on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] by a [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]].
Gained this turn
Precisely Deadly

Buildings cost [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] and {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to build, but grant a variety of benefits when completed which are shown on their icon tooltips.

Existing buildings may be upgraded to other buildings of the same [[sl:campaign_building_types]]type[[/sl]], or entirely new buildings may be constructed in empty [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]slots[[/sl]] within a settlement.

Buildings may be damaged by enemy [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] or in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Damaged buildings do not provide their full benefits until they are repaired.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_building_browser]]Building Browser[[/sl_tooltip]] may be opened to browse all constructable buildings at once.

The strength of the Geomantic Web affects the power of commandments issued across your territory.

A settlement must be linked to another of equal or higher strength if it is to operate at its maximum potential strength.

The colour of the rings around settlements indicate the current strength of the Geomantic Web there. A pulsing ring indicates that a settlement is not operating at its maximum potential strength - upgrade the strength of the web in nearby settlements in this case.
Deliberately Callous

The [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage of a Beastmen army decreases slowly over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]]. If it gets too low, the warriors will get restless and start fighting each other, causing casualties.
Turn fire-at-will off to conserve ammunition, or to prevent casualties being inflicted on allied troops fighting nearby.
Cunning and deceptive, no other Vampires have infiltrated human society in the same way as the Lahmians' shadowy sisterhood.
The strength of a new Blood Voyage army is proportional to that of Hellebron's [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] at the time.
[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes, like other [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]], will improve their skills as they perform successful actions.
The strength of the Winds of Magic in a province is shown on the tooltip if the cursor is placed over the land.

Population surplus cost||This is the amount of [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus required to construct this building. This cost can increase as you construct additional horde buildings.
roll
Highly-skilled in the noble art of controlled violence, this one is eager to demonstrate his talents at every given opportunity.

The more armies you field, the harder it becomes to maintain them all. As supply lines become more complex, gold and supplies will ‘go missing’ -  your officials having little idea where they may have gone...
Scavenge
Followers & Banners
Action-Reaction
The presence of a resource in a settlement is indicated by an icon on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_settlement_bars]]Settlement bar[[/sl_tooltip]].
Access to a resource is established by constructing a [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] in the settlement of a [[sl:campaign_building_types]]type[[/sl]] that permits resource acquisition.

Once access to a resource is established, the controlling faction will automatically begin to [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade that resource with its partners, bringing in extra {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]].
The types of resource available are shown on the {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]].
Control of resources makes it more likely that other factions will accept a [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreement.
The God of the Desert is invoked, and a mighty sandstorm blasts across the dunes to rid the Land of the Dead of trespassers both living and dead.
Brutally Cunning
Only Tomb Kings factions collect [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars.
We have attained complete control of this [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]]province[[/tooltip]][[/url]].
[[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]Bestial rage is also decreased when an army takes casualties.
The advisor appears from time to time to offer his assistance to the player. The level of advice can be reduced or minimised through the game options.

Legend has it that Harkon himself captured the Hellhammer which provided this brutal piece of artillery. They say Bess is cursed, or more rightly, those victims caught in her crosshairs are the real cursed ones.
The missions list shows active [[sl:campaign_quests]]quests[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]] on the user interface.
The Forbidden Workshop can be accessed from the main campaign interface when playing as the Clan Skryre faction.

Various technological units and mounts in addition to [[img:icon_doomrocket]][[/img]]Doomrockets can all be upgraded within the various research tabs of the Forbidden Workshop by spending [[img:icon_warp_fuel]][[/img]]Warp-Fuel and [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food resources. The current amounts of both resources can be viewed at the top of the panel.

[[img:icon_warp_fuel]][[/img]]Warp-Fuel can be acquired by winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] when Ikit Claw or a Warlock Master are in the leading [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], or by successfully performing [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]agent actions[[/sl]] with Engineer [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes.
Some upgrades are available at the beginning of the campaign, while others require the Forbidden Workshop to be upgraded first in order to unlock them.
The Forbidden Workshop can be upgraded by completing the requirements outlined in the tooltip on the Workshop Level bar at the top of the panel.
On completion of the requirements for each Forbidden Workshop Level, it will be upgraded to unlock new parts within all research tabs.
Upgrades are permanent, applied across all applicable units, mounts, and [[img:icon_doomrocket]][[/img]]Doomrockets once unlocked.
Upgrades cannot be removed or refunded once unlocked.

Each research tab for upgrading Doom-Flayers, Doomwheels, and Weapons Teams has a progression bar at the bottom. When an individual upgrade is researched, progress is added to the bar. As the bar fills up, powerful technological items are awarded which can be equipped to any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord.
Hostile actions with [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes do not directly lead to war. They may be discovered, however, which will worsen relations between the factions involved.

Strategic moves are played out in the campaign game. [[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] wage [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] and make [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliances[[/sl]] in an effort to capture [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] territory from one another.
The Winds of Magic panel is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface.
Clan Loyalty

Each of Ulthuan's regions is of great importance to the High Elves, and to those protected by the Fortress Gates inside the inner ring of the island, even more so. The fight for control of the island has been a long-standing affair and key to almost every war the Asur have ever fought. Alarielle, unlike her predecessors, has taken a most active role in the defence of Ulthuan; now, more than ever, its denizens look to her for protection.

[[sl:battle_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] may occasionally enter battle with army-wide abilities that are not tied to the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lord[[/sl]] or to an individual [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]]. Army abilities may be browsed and activated from the Army Abilities panel.
The tooltip on the Canopic Jars icon at the top of the campaign interface shows a breakdown of Canopic Jar production and consumption.
Zoom to brayherd target
Come, join us instead - the shackles of disease and death shall be but a distant memory.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may expand and capture any [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. However, no [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] will thrive everywhere, each having a set of specific climate preferences. Settlements of an unsuitable climate type will [[sl:campaign_growth]]grow[[/sl]] more slowly, if occupied, and suffer a variety of other penalties.
Increase Mobility

A [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] must be managed by the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] or factions that control it to remain productive, and to prevent it from degenerating into [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]].
Number of available items/units to craft/awaken
Banners can be won through battle, and may be assigned to specific units in order to improve their performance.
Taxes

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] belonging to the same faction may exchange [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], in order to better redistribute their forces. Select a controllable army and right-click on another to exchange units between them.
Gatherer
Schlenter
The Blessings of the Lady provide protection in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] for [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnians[[/sl]] who have shown heroism through their previous actions.
Mark of Chaos
The enemy has moved to intercept your army as you move through the Worldroots. Prepare for battle!
Are you sure you wish to disband the selection?
Evil must be turned from its nefarious course, by any means necessary.
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_recruit_hero_panel_link]]Recruit Hero Panel[[/sl_tooltip]]
[[sl:battle_infantry]]Infantry[[/sl]] units are generally slow, but heavily armed and armoured.
[[sl:battle_missile_units]]Missile units[[/sl]] are usually lightly armoured and vulnerable to strikes by mounted troops.
[[sl:battle_monsters]]Monsters[[/sl]] are tough but vulnerable against spear and missile troops.
[[sl:battle_flying_units]]Flying units[[/sl]] are fast but vulnerable against missiles.
[[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] are powerful but vulnerable against physical attack.
Total Favour
The [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage of a selected army is shown on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].
Toggle fire-at-will on a selected unit with the [[sl_tooltip:battle_fire_at_will_button]]Fire-at-Will button[[/sl_tooltip]].
Lahmia's Fortune

The warped history of the corrupted Skaven race lists their many attempts to overthrow and enslave the other civilisations under the iron claw of Skaven rule. Now, under your control, the verminous hordes seethe openly across the face of the world, chittering their triumph in praise of the Great Horned Rat!
Collector
[[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] factions may strengthen the [[sl:campaign_geomantic_web]]Geomantic Web[[/sl]] to boost the power of any commandments they issue.
Only Tomb Kings factions benefit from the Realm of Souls.
Auto-resolve||Automatically resolve the battle if you have a clear advantage over the enemy. However, you will have a better chance at victory should you fight the battle manually.
The Great Plan sometimes requires the knowledge of lesser races to serve its many-splintered design.
Riots
Gain control of [[sl:campaign_norsca]]Norscan Tribes[[/sl]] through the language of [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

Weapon Types
The number of soldiers remaining in a unit, the unit’s experience level and its remaining ammunition, if any, are indicated on its Unit card.
The tooltip on a Unit card displays more information about the status of the unit.
A Unit card will flash red when the unit it represents comes under attack, and will turn grey when that unit is [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]].

Other information indicated on a Unit card includes whether the subject unit is [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]moving[[/sl]], firing [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile weapons[[/sl]], or being fired upon.
Double-left-click on a Unit card to zoom the [[sl:battle_camera_controls]]camera[[/sl]] to the associated unit.

[[col:yellow]]Completing missions may result in one or more of your [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords gaining [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty. Failing missions may have the opposite effect.[[/col]]
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_regiments_of_renown_link]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl_tooltip]]
Chaos artefacts will cease to spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] after some [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] has passed.
Artefacts, such as Chaos Rifts or Herdstones, may be destroyed by recolonising the ruined settlement.
Lore Keeper

[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] within [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] are represented on the user interface as Unit Cards. Each card displays essential information about the unit it represents.
