Armies with very low [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness will suffer losses due to [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.

Intervention [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] may be hired by [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] to interfere with [[sl:campaign_rituals]]rituals[[/sl]] being conducted by their rivals. They are composed of mercenaries and fanatics dedicated to capturing or destroying the ritual sites.
When checked, any auto or quick saves will be saved individually, with incremental file names.
Brayherd triggered!
Dark Magic Summary

Interested [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] may influence the Great Vortex within the Eye of the Vortex campaign by spending [[sl:campaign_ritual_currency]]ritual currency[[/sl]] to complete a sequence of [[sl:campaign_rituals]]rituals[[/sl]].

Magic items obtained by a character are assigned automatically if no item is already assigned to that slot. Magic items that are not assigned to a character may be assigned to others within the faction.
Legendary Lords may win unique items through quest chains. These are automatically equipped and cannot be passed to other characters.
Magic items are obtained through a variety of successful actions, and may be equipped by your Lords and Heroes to improve their performance.
Hold shift when right-clicking to enqueue a waypoint, or hold shift and drag a path for units with the right mouse button.
Hold CTRL when right-clicking and dragging out a formation to walk units into their specified positions. This is useful when concealing units in forested [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]].
Hold ALT, and left-click and drag on a selection on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] to move units in formation.
Units in Guard mode won’t pursue a fleeing enemy. Guard mode can be activated by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_guard_button]]Guard button[[/sl_tooltip]].
Multiple units may be [[sl:battle_grouping]]grouped[[/sl]] by pressing G, and placed in [[sl:battle_formations]]formations[[/sl]].
You are running an [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber deficit. Capture additional settlements or disband units that require [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber to solve this crisis!
This one likes a drink - be it a fine Bretonnian vintage or the nastiest grog found in the darkest slums - but then, who doesn't?
Come to me, mead! Bring thy beer! An ale or three! Spirits for thee! Any liquor will do, as long as it's not water.
A sober agent is more functional and competent, but is he more fun?

The type of each [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]], which indicates its general form and usage, is shown on its [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Card[[/sl]]. Examples of unit types include infantry and artillery.

Settlements are cities or [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] from which [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] are defended and controlled. Ownership of a settlement grants ownership of the territory around it.

[[col:red]]You need %n [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus.[[/col]]||The ship's crew will grow over time; constructing appropriate buildings will help increase its rate of [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth.
Any banners that randomly drop after victory in battle are shown on the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_panel]]Post-Battle panel[[/sl]].

A banner or mark may be assigned to a unit on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]] or Post-Battle panel by dragging the banner icon on to that unit's [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]].
A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord may carry up to six banners in his [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]].

Banners are shared across the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]]. A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord may be given possession of a vacant banner on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
Mortuary Cult
The Forgotten Altar of the Emerald Pools
Moving here will increase [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption in the local province.

The amount of ritual currency accrued can be tracked on the [[sl:campaign_rituals_bar]]Rituals bar[[/sl]], together with the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_ritual_rival_icons]]ritual progress of rival races[[/sl_tooltip]].

The Tomb Kings are the undying rulers of the desolate, wind-swept deserts of Nehekhara. Rising from their sarcophagi, their mummified forms possess the same thirst for conquest in Undeath that drove them in life.

The [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] maintain the [[sl:campaign_geomantic_web]]Geomantic Web[[/sl]], an unseen network of magical energy that spans the world.
The Lizardmen are occasional beneficiaries of [[sl:campaign_blessed_spawnings]]blessed spawnings[[/sl]] - events where warriors of unusual potency are birthed in spawning pools of Lustria.

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] of the Lizardmen may use the [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_astromancy]]Astromancy stance[[/sl]] to detect their surroundings more effectively.
Lizardmen factions can spend {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to conduct [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] to gain powerful bonuses.
The Rite of Primeval Glory spawns a Lizardmen army of Feral Bastiladons, Stegadons and Carnosaurs.

Each Tomb King dynasty researched will increase the number of [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords the faction may [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]recruit[[/sl]], and the number of [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] it may field, by one.
Powerful [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords may be made available for recruitment by researching them. One [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord can be researched within each Dynasty.
The ability to recruit additional [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes may be gained by researching the relevant technologies.
Undaunted by Numbers
Place the mouse cursor over the timer to see who wins when the time runs out.

Yet what is talk of empires to the destroyer of all civilisations? Let the shattered cities smoulder to ash, let briar and thorn reclaim their tumbled stones and bleached bones. Your warherds roam lands returned to their primal roots, braying a triumphant challenge to storm-wracked skies!
Any faction that completes its final ritual and defeats its rivals will gain control of the vortex and [[sl:campaign_victory_conditions]]win the campaign[[/sl]].
Dwarfs tend to eschew risk, but not you.
The Events list may be viewed by clicking the Events button on the campaign interface.

The reclusive Asrai are a [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] of Elves that long ago separated from their kin in order to live as one with nature. Striking out from their forest home of Athel Loren, the Wood Elves see themselves as guardians of the natural world.

Inactivity and military defeats will cause your mob'z [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness to drop, leading to infighting. Keep fightiness high by winning battles or adopting the [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Raidin' Camp stance.
Rival Under-City Discovered!
Move the camera in battle with the W, A, S and D keys. Orient the camera by holding the middle mouse button, and change the camera height with the scroll wheel.

The Extra Powder [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit ability[[/sl]] increases the damage of [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] in a Vampire Coast [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] while their ammunition level is above 80% of its starting value.
Units may be [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]] and given [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]orders[[/sl]] on the tactical map.
The Great Vortex may only be manipulated in the Eye of the Vortex campaign.
Dynasties||Advance your faction's capabilities and recruit new [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes by delving through your ancient dynasty's secrets.
Walls of timber or stone are of little use afore the scream of the Banshee - a sound so powerful it can damage even the mightiest defences.
hold

The Character Info panel appears in the bottom-left of the screen when a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] is selected on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. It shows the portrait of the selected [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero or [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]], their remaining [[sl_tooltip:campaign_movement_range]]movement range[[/sl_tooltip]] and other information.

[[col:red]]You need %n [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus.[[/col]]||This horde will grow over time; constructing appropriate buildings will help increase its rate of [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth.
A powerful ritual that shall clarify how the Great Warding interacts and bolsters the island servant's Vortex. However, as one way is cleared, another will be blocked...
The most powerful of rituals translated from the ancient plaques. Alignment is needed to bring the Vortex under cold-blooded control, but a key must be found to unlock the final barrier.

The ritual is powerful indeed - upon its completion it will rouse a Relic-Priest of the First Generation. Its inscrutable knowledge and interpretation of the Great Plan shall reveal the correct course of action.
Pitiless Murderer

On this ritual's completion a great cosmos engine shall be activated - a machine that can channel Geomantic thermals to shore up the Great Warding. Much rumination is needed on how to start such a device...
The power of this ritual will rise those that contemplate the Vortex's fate ever closer to the stars. With the firmament in reach, the answer to this crisis will surely come.
It is said that when the dead come from the sea to stalk the land they are shrouded in fell mist, a thick, evil fog which gathers around the admiral commanding them.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] of the same [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] may choose to [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]]confederate into one faction if conditions between them are right. [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]]Confederation can be agreed via [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_day_of_awakening]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Day of Awakening[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb Kings factions can recruit units into their armies without the need to pay for their recruitment or upkeep. Instead, each unit has a limited initial recruitment capacity which can be increased by constructing additional buildings.

[[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Dynasties[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb King factions must delve into their past secrets to increase the number of armies or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes they can field, or to enlist the aid of mighty [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords from ancient dynasties.

[[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Mortuary Cult[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Tomb Kings can spend their [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars within the Mortuary Cult, where Liche Priests combine them with [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade resources to craft magic items or awaken Legions of Legend - mighty warriors who can be recruited to battle.

Learn more about Tomb Kings [[url:script_link_campaign_tomb_kings]]here[[/url]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Skaven Under-Empire[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The Skaven can lurk beneath any settlement or ruin, growing their empire by either occupying regions or establishing [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities beneath them. Left undetected for too long, their malevolent scheming can result in hordes of vermin rising up to [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corrupt the land or assault illustrious cities without warning.

[[url:script_link_campaign_food]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Food[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
Skaven factions require a stockpile of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food, each army consuming an amount of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food per turn. [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]Food may be acquired from battles, by sacking settlements, and through certain buildings.

[[url:script_link_campaign_corruption]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Skaven Corruption[[/tooltip]][[/url]]
The Skaven spread [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corruption wherever they settle, lowering [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order over time but giving additional uses of the [[url:script_link_campaign_the_menace_below]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_the_menace_below}}]]Menace Below[[/tooltip]][[/url]] army ability during battles fought within the local province.

The strength of the Winds of Magic in a province may be increased or decreased by certain [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl_tooltip]], [[sl:campaign_stances]]stances[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]heroic actions[[/sl]].

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord is also increased through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic actions[[/sl]] with amicable factions and by ensuring that the faction leader is of a higher [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]] than them.

Establish [[sl:campaign_outposts]]outposts[[/sl]] to gain wealth, [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] hubs; these can be established in conquered [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]port settlements[[/sl]] outside of Norsca.

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes can move independently of armies, and can freely move into enemy territory.
A selected [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero can join with a controlled army or move into a controlled settlement by right-clicking the target.
A [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero marching with an army will fight alongside that army in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes cannot be attacked by enemy armies, only by enemy [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes.
Certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] must be constructed before a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero may be recruited. Building requirements are shown on the Hero Recruitment panel.
Followers, Runes & Banners

Horde [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] reside with their armies. Available building options for a selected Horde army may be seen on the [[sl:campaign_building_panel]]Building panel[[/sl]], viewable by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_building_panel_tab]]Building tab[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].
Horde armies may only construct new buildings when in [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Encamp [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_horde_growth]]Growth[[/sl]] within Horde armies produces [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, which can be spent on building construction.
Certain factions, such as [[sl:campaign_rogue_armies]]Rogue Armies[[/sl]], may choose to become hordes. Such factions may later choose to settle once more by taking control of a settlement.
The [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] are hordes by default and cannot inhabit settlements.

Soldiers tire as they [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]run[[/sl]] and fight, meaning that they cannot engage in combat as effectively. The vigour level of a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is shown on its tooltip.

If it gets high enough a [[sl:campaign_brayherds]]brayherd[[/sl]] will appear.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_local_recruitment_pool]]local[[/sl_tooltip]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_recruitment_pool]]global[[/sl_tooltip]] recruitment options display [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Cards[[/sl]] representing [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]unit types[[/sl]] that may recruited by the selected army.

An army may generally recruit several units at once. The number of [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] that can be recruited at a time from each recruitment pool is [[sl_tooltip:campaign_recruitment_capacity]]indicated on the Recruitment panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

The Province Info panel appears alongside the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]] when a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is selected, and displays information about the state of the [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] and its population.

The starting [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty for each [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord available for [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]recruitment[[/sl]] can vary. Starting loyalty values are indicated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
The owner of a settlement containing a [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Cove will experience no negative effects of it being established there.

[[sl:campaign_dark_elf_loyalty]]Dark Elf loyalty[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_skaven_loyalty]]Skaven loyalty[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_vampiric_loyalty]]Vampire loyalty[[/sl]] are all influenced by different factors.
The Commandments rollout is inactive if the selected settlement is not in a province that is controlled completely.
Defeating Champions is a requirement for campaign victory.

Each [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] must make the best use of the battlefield [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] to achieve victory.
The radar map and [[sl:battle_tactical_map]]tactical map[[/sl]] show the full extent of the battlefield.

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can perform actions to serve their [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], either in support of a controlled [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]], or to strike at an enemy army, settlement or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero.

A [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] will feel the effects of bankruptcy should it run out of {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term_sentence_start}}[[/sl]] will suffer greatly, and unpaid troops will desert their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]].

[[sl:battle_battle_game]]Battles[[/sl]] are contested by armies, each of which is made up of many troop [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]]. The player commands an army when taking part in a battle.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] are defended by [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] characters. Each character has its own attributes that can benefit or sometimes hinder the faction.

The Faction Summary screen can be displayed by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_faction_summary_button]]Faction Summary button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_faction_summary_summary_tab]]Summary tab[[/sl_tooltip]] shows information about the current state of the faction, as well an image of the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] who leads the faction.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_faction_summary_records_tab]]Records tab[[/sl_tooltip]] shows a timeline of important events which have occurred during the game.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_faction_summary_statistics_tab]]Statistics tab[[/sl_tooltip]] shows faction statistics.
Options shown on the Post-Battle panel are contextual, and depend upon the combatants and the location of the battle.

The Skills button on the Character Details panel can be clicked to show learned and available skills.
The coloured area surrounding a selected army shows how far it can move this turn.

A [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Cove can be established in any foreign [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port after winning a battle there or via [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]].
Study the information on the {{tr:hp_campaign_treasury_panel_term}} to work out where to save {{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}.

The Machine of Doom and Curses is ready! The Grey Seer Clan and their masters on the Council of Thirteen tried to betray you… but now, thanks to the scribe’s wrath, it is the Grey Seer’s blood imprinted on the unholy bell’s Warpstone clapper! And so the Grey Seer Clan shall be sacrificed - consumed by the Horned Rat on His arrival. Upon the Isle of the Dead, in the heart of hated Ulthuan, the machine begins its work - turning the Vortex into a portal from which your god shall emerge. The other races sense the peril and converge to stop you. Above all, the Grey Seers send their minions - desperate to halt the Great Ascendancy. The unholy bell must toll thirteen times - prepare for the ultimate battle!
There are many interface panels that may be used by the player to help manage their [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]]. Explore them by clicking the various buttons on the user interface.
Pirate Coves are hidden buildings within other factions' [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]ports.
The number of turns until a rebellion occurs in a province is shown on the {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} tooltip on the Province Info panel.
[[col:red]]You have insufficient [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence[[/col]]

A commandment may be issued by a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] it controls completely. Commandments provide powerful bonuses, and may be issued from the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_oak_of_ages]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Oak of Ages[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\nAt the heart of Athel Loren stands the Oak of Ages, which the Wood Elves must fully rejuvenate in order to achieve victory.

Additional [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] drawn into a battle on the campaign map appear as reinforcements. Reinforcing armies appear at the edge of the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] during the fighting.

A garrison army costs no upkeep, but can be depleted by repeated [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]].
The garrison units a building provides are shown when the cursor is placed over the building icon on the Province Overview panel.

The garrison army a settlement provides can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]], by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_garrison_details_button]]Garrison Details button[[/sl_tooltip]].
In a multi-player campaign, Lord Kroak will only be available to the first Lizardmen faction that summons him.

The [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lord in control of the faction is shown on the Faction Summary screen, even if the campaign game was started with an alternative [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord.
Headings on the Province Info panel can be clicked to open Help pages about the relevant topics.

The current growth towards your next [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus point and next turn’s growth are displayed on the Growth Information panel. When growth reaches a certain threshold, a [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus point is earned.

Chapter objectives are issued in the campaign as the player's faction grows, and can be seen on the Objectives panel.
Available quests and the rank at which they become available are shown on the skills tab of the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
Completing a quest may involve several individual tasks which must be finished in order.
Currently-active quests are shown on the Missions list.
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_magic_items]]Magic items[[/sl_tooltip]] gained by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lord completing a quest cannot be traded with other Lords.

The Unit Details panel can also be toggled by pressing the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_details_button]]Unit Details button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_portrait_panel]]Unit Portrait panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Tooltips on the various statistics and effects shown describe their meaning and consequences in more detail.
Hover the mouse cursor over an army on the campaign map to see which nearby forces it supports. An arrow is drawn where reinforcement would occur.

The [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison army[[/sl]] provided by [[sl:campaign_buildings]]settlement buildings[[/sl]] may support a nearby allied army, and vice-versa. In this way, an army stationed next to a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] will assist in that settlement’s defence.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of reinforcing armies are shown on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]].

Ritual resource site||Constructing an Old One Trove building here will provide a steady stream of [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_lizardmen/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]Ancient Plaques.

The goblet brims with the lifeforce of victims claimed by your sorcerous vassal and her assassin. Now is the time to move on hated Ulthuan and claim the power of the Vortex! The other races sense the peril and converge to stop you! Yet the vermin have been enacting their own devious, world-shattering plot. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Vortex is your tool for ultimate vengeance; the Skaven must be stopped - prepare for the ultimate battle!

At the very heart of Ulthuan, upon the Isle of the Dead, the greatest of all battles must be fought. Enemies from many realms gather, ready for war. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Star Crown is now re-forged and so the Vortex can be saved, but first the Skaven must be stopped - prepare for the ultimate battle!
Lord Kroak, through his campaign agent actions, can demolish an entire level of a settlement's main building chain when attacking.
The Book of Grudges can be opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_grudges_button]]Grudges button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the user interface.

Grudges are [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]] issued to a Dwarf [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] to avenge the loss of an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term_sentence_start}}[[/sl]] will suffer as more grudges are built up. This is shown on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_grudges_bar]]Grudges bar[[/sl_tooltip]] on the user interface.
Non-Dwarf factions do not keep grudges.

Once forbidden knowledge is acquired, Necromancers and Vampires will jealously guard it from rivals' eyes.
Only Bretonnian factions may summon the [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]]Green Knight.
While the accuracy of a zombie firing a gun remains questionable, the damage caused by the pirate gunners of the Vampire Coast is increased while their ammunition level remains high.
Sacrifice of Pok-Hopak\n\n[[col:green]][[img:icon_spawning]][[/img]]Unlocks Pok-Hopak Cohort (Cold One Riders - Spears)
Greenskins are belligerent gits. They will fight anyone, especially each other.

Armies that wish to fight one another on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] will meet in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. The strength of an army is indicated on its banner.
An army can [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] extra [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], but must remain stationary to do so.
An army must always be commanded by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]].

A selected army may be garrisoned in a controlled settlement by right-clicking on it. The army will defend the settlement from attack and boost [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] there.
A faction may [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]raise additional armies[[/sl]] at any time, although the process costs {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]].
The {{tr:icon_treasury}}Treasury panel also shows expenditure from sources such as [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]] upkeep and [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] construction.

The {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl_tooltip:campaign_income_per_turn]]income per-turn[[/sl_tooltip]] is the total expenditure subtracted from the total {{tr:icon_income}}income, and is shown at the top of the campaign interface.
A faction with a negative {{tr:icon_income}}income per-turn is at risk of going [[sl:campaign_bankruptcy]]bankrupt[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]Disband units[[/sl]] or take other steps to reduce costs to maintain a positive {{tr:icon_income}}income per-turn.
The Army Abilities panel is shown on the right side of the screen when army abilities are available for use.

Pirates of the Vampire Coast gain [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy by winning battles, claiming settlements, and establishing [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_pirate_coves]]Pirate Coves[[/sl]].

The [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy rank of the faction leader can be seen [[sl_tooltip:campaign_infamy_link]]at the top of the screen[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing as a pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord of the Vampire Coast.
A pirate Lord will rise up the ranks of the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_infamy_link]]Infamy list[[/sl_tooltip]] as they gain [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy.

Pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] who hold [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]] can be provoked into a confrontation by overtaking them on the Infamy list.

[[url:script_link_campaign_gathering_of_the_ancients]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Gathering of the Ancients[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\nA variety of benefits may be gained by appointing Treemen [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords to the Gathering of the Ancients.
Only Avelorn is affected by Defender of Ulthuan.
Gifts of Chaos and banners can be won in battle, and may be assigned to specific units in order to improve their performance.

The races fighting for control of the [[sl:campaign_great_vortex]]Great Vortex[[/sl]] each collect different types of ritual currency. [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_high_elves/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]Way-fragments, [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]] collect [[img:ui/skins/warhammer2/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]the Scrolls of Hekarti, [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_lizardmen/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]ancient plaques and [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_skaven/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]Warpstone.
Ritual currency is not consumed when a ritual is conducted.

Ritual currency can be earned from a variety of sources including [[sl:campaign_searching_ruins]]Searching Ruins[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_quests]]Quests[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_missions]]Missions[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_ritual_resource_sites]]Ritual resource sites[[/sl]] produce a large amount of currency, and can be found across the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].
Pirate Crew Income
Currency requirements for a ritual are shown on the cursor tooltips of the ritual button on the [[sl:campaign_rituals_bar]]Rituals bar[[/sl]].

Send an intervention force of high quality units to target the ritual sites.
Send an intervention force of low quality units to target the ritual sites.

Lord Kroak will be automatically summoned after completing his unique quest chain, which will become available during the course of the campaign for each playable Lizardman Legendary Lord.

Flashing nodes on the Geomantic Web are operating a power level below their potential. Upgrade a connecting node to increase its power.

Victory! In a world of Chaos, a time of heroes - an age of war - you have overcome every challenge laid before you and faced down every foe bent upon your destruction. This strange and dangerous realm, riven with battle, bloodshed and slaughter, twisted beyond sanity by the warping power of Chaos, has seen the foundering of many a mighty empire, yet yours remains triumphant and unconquered, victorious in defiance of all!
The Forgotten Altar of Qurveza Basin

Milk and beef from cows, mutton, pork, and goat are all valuable commodities in a hungry nation.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] can research technologies over time. Technologies are researched on the [[sl:campaign_technology_panel]]Technology panel[[/sl]] and bring a variety of civic and military benefits.

Each player [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] has its own victory conditions which, if achieved, will win them the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]]. Victory conditions can be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_objectives_panel]]Objectives panel[[/sl]].

Flying units can engage each other in hand-to-hand fighting without descending onto the terrain.

[[img:icon_ritual_currency]][[/img]]Ancient Plaques are produced by buildings and are given as rewards for completing missions and searching ruins. Once enough have been collected, a ritual can be performed.

The Great Vortex siphons the greater part of the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] from the world, and is thus all that holds back an unstoppable tide of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] from the realms beyond. In the Eye of the Vortex campaign, the vortex is unstable, and several [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] of the world work to influence it to their own ends.
This can be crafted/awakened multiple times.

Province capitals feature fortification [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] that may be upgraded to improve the settlement defences.

Fortifications may be attacked in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] using [[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]monstrous units[[/sl]], and by [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]] prior to battle.
Fortified settlements hold out for longer under siege.
Fortifications may be constructed within smaller settlements once the settlement building reaches its highest level.

Goblin Workshop||Advance your faction's capabilities through Goblin contraptions.

Amanar will attack coastal regions and sea regions indiscriminately without warning, leaving [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port settlements devastated and causing [[img:icon_transport_fleet]][[/img]]fleets to suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional[[/sl]] casualties wherever it ascends.

The Undead [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] are hell-bent on controlling the creature. They compete with one another to secure the Star-metal Harpoon, the only weapon that can kill the monster.

The Star-metal Harpoon may be gained by completing "The Search for the Vengeance" [[sl:campaign_missions]]mission[[/sl]], and then must be cursed with the [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]] in order to fell the beast.
Extra Powder
It drinks from the mortals like a sewer fish released into a meadow stream.
This vampire would bathe in rivers of blood, if he could.
Consumed by the thirst, such sires will forget their true calling.

Certain [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] around the Eye of the Vortex [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] are rich in [[sl:campaign_ritual_currency]]ritual currency[[/sl]]. Construction of a specific [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] within the settlement will earn the controlling [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] a steady stream of ritual currency revenue.
Apparently, it is possible to spin assassination so it appears to be an honourable act.
Control

The type of terrain varies across a [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can affect [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]army movement[[/sl]]. Sufficiently hostile environments can cause [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional[[/sl]] casualties in armies trying to move through them.
The Warriors of Chaos cannot inhabit [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], instead roaming the map as [[sl:campaign_hordes]]hordes[[/sl]].

The Warriors of Chaos may occasionally gain [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]allies[[/sl]] by awakening old tribes in the north after winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] at enemy settlements.
[[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Chaos Rifts[[/sl]], which spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption to nearby settlements, are left behind in settlements razed by Warriors of Chaos.
Only the Warriors of Chaos can move through the Chaos Wastes in the far north without suffering heavy [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]].
Port buildings are worth developing as they generate plenty of growth and {{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term_plural}}.
Recruit selected [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero at the current settlement.
Excluding a province from tax reduces the number of units that may be recruited at one time there.
Public Order
Set brayherd target||The brayherd army will focus its attack at the target that you set.
Astromancy
Once the noblest of the Empire's knightly orders, the Blood Dragons are a ferocious force in battle, with a bond far stronger than any living knights.
Some stances may only be used by armies of certain [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]].
A selected army may be switched into a different stance from the stances rollout, on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].
The tooltips on the various Stance buttons show detailed information about the benefits and drawbacks of each one.
Certain stances require that the army still has a portion of its [[sl_tooltip:campaign_movement_range]]movement range[[/sl_tooltip]].
Like [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]mounted units[[/sl]], flying units can be rapidly deployed to strike at a vulnerable target or reinforce a weak point in the [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]].

If [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] is high when a rebellion occurs then the rebel army may consist of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/skv]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]], or [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]vampiric[[/sl]] forces.
Click the Continue Siege button to exit the Siege panel whilst maintaining the siege.
If a revolutionary army appears it must be crushed swiftly, otherwise it will gather strength and attack.
Click the Break Siege button to lift the siege and retreat from the city.
A rebellion occurs if the [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} in a province drops to -100.

The Attack and Auto-Resolve buttons will become active when siege weapons are built, or when another method of overcoming the fortifications becomes available.\n\nThe fortifications may be breached by siege weapons, artillery, monsters or giants, or by any unit if they have been sufficiently damaged in a previous attack.
[[col:yellow]]This horde needs to be placed into the [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Encamp stance in order to finish demolishing this building. Left-click to cancel the order.[[/col]]
Crushing the rebellion will not solve the underlying [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} problem, which must be tackled separately.

Corruption is a measure of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] influence in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]], and is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]]. Excessive corruption in a province can lead to [[sl:campaign_public_order]]unrest[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attrition[[/sl]], and eventually an uprising if left unchecked.
The Toggle Strategic Overview button is shown in the top-right corner of the campaign interface.
To warn this one of the enemy's numbers is to insult him deeply, which is a very dangerous thing to do!
The patron of seers and prophets. She is prayed to for clarity, prophecy, and foresight.
The battlefield terrain may be previewed on the Siege panel by clicking the Scout Terrain button.
This Waaagh! army will disband should its [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness drop below 80.
In order to research this technology, this settlement must be captured and held for a turn.
Dwarf [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] maintain a record of grievances in their Book of [[sl:campaign_grudges]]Grudges[[/sl]].
Dwarf factions may make use of the [[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]] to travel under otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].
Dwarfs cannot field [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]mounted units[[/sl]] but can use their engineering skills to build a variety of unique weapons of war.

Once your horde’s [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth reaches a certain threshold, [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus points are earned, which can be spent on constructing new horde buildings, raising new hordes, or recruiting new agents.

Invoking the Serpent-God makes the jungles themselves turn against the intruders and interlopers who dare invade His realm.

Towers, gates and other [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] features may be captured by an attacker during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]] if they take control of the nearby capture point.

An invocation against ill-luck, thereby - in Dawi logic - making the Dwarf lucky.

Units assigned into a formation are automatically placed into a [[sl:battle_grouping]]group[[/sl]].

The Lords of Decay have spoken! We-we invoke their scheme - the Thirteenth Plot - all Skavendom must unite against things!
The character's rank and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_available_skill_points]]available skill points[[/sl_tooltip]] are shown at the top of the panel.

Click the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_details_button]]Details [[/sl_tooltip]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_skills_button]]Skills[[/sl_tooltip]] buttons to switch between the tabs on this panel.

The left of the panel shows character stats and effects, which determine the [[sl:campaign_characters]]character's[[/sl]] performance in [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign[[/sl]] and in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]]Raiding enemy territory causes [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]unhappiness in the targeted [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin[[/sl]] armies may construct a [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Raidin’ Camp in enemy territory by entering the relevant stance.

Orcs and Goblins band together on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and are collectively referred to as Greenskins. Greenskins live for nothing but violence, and can be incited into a near-unstoppable [[sl:campaign_waaagh]]Waaagh![[/sl]] if sufficiently roused.
Unruly||If [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage drops below 40, with no one to fight, the warherd will fight each other and begin to take [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.

The campaign map is the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]] setting on which [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] are created, surveyed, commanded and destroyed.
It is a rare occasion indeed when even the advanced magical learning of Ulthuan proves insufficient for the task at hand.
Why do anything by halves? I'd rather kill the urks outright. Ahhh well, orders are orders…
For those without scruples, any means are justified to get what you want.
Worldroots permeate the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can be used by the Wood Elves to navigate through otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].
Underway Interception!
No faction will own a settlement after it’s been razed.
A razed settlement can be recolonised by an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], but this action costs [[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] may spread [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] to surrounding settlements by razing a settlement and leaving a [[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Chaos artefact[[/sl]] there.

An offering to the Queen of Vengeance cannot be any mere kill. It has to be a one sought through revenge - the wronged party achieving the retribution due. However, such acts will most likely glean Drakira’s attention.

Elven Halls are major [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] within the forest of Athel Loren. They contain many more [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]] than [[sl:campaign_asrai_lookouts]]Asrai Lookouts[[/sl]], and [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] constructed within them can open positions on the [[sl:campaign_elven_council]]Elven Council[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_gathering_of_the_ancients]]Gathering of the Ancients[[/sl]].

If you join with them you are aligning yourself with a foe most foul. Come, brothers, accept Sigmar's loving embrace.

Brazen & Fearless
Only Har Ganeth may initiate a Blood Voyage.
Clan Eshin's assassins scurry away swiftly and generally before the foe has been roused to their presence.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] within a pirate faction of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] can be assigned to a position of Fleet Office once they have achieved a sufficient character [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]], granting them a senior role within the grand fleet. Positions of office confer bonuses on the Lords that occupy them, as well as improving their [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]].

An ambush battle is fought when one [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] surprises another on the campaign map. The defender starts the battle surrounded by the attacker, with no chance to [[sl:battle_deployment]]deploy[[/sl]].
Khorne's Wrath
You are already fielding the current maximum number of Black Arks. A new Black Ark will become available after occupying an additional Major Port settlement.

Deployment

Black Arks are great floating fortresses of war, torn from the earth by the mighty magic of the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]]. They terrorise the [[sl:campaign_sea]]seas[[/sl]], roaming in support of the [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of the Dark Elves on land.
Total Favour
The Forgotten Altar of Gwangee Valley
[[col:red]]Global recruitment is only available whilst garrisoned or in the [[img:icon_entombed_stance]][[/img]]Entombed Beneath the Sands stance.[[/col]]
Advice history can be navigated using the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_advice_history_buttons]]back and forwards buttons[[/sl_tooltip]] on the Advisor panel.
Advice history can be reset on the game options so that previously-seen advice will be shown again.
The advisor can be dismissed or recalled at any time by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_advisor_button]]advisor button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.

The [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} level of a province can be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]]. The factors affecting [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} can be viewed on the tooltip on this panel.

Ancient and terrible power still courses through the Bloodlines of the Midnight Aristocracy. Through the time-worn practice of the [[img:icon_blood_kiss]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:campaign_blood_kiss]]Blood Kiss[[/sl_tooltip]] that power may yet be awakened.

[[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] factions rely on the availability of a stockpile of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food. While bonuses are received when [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food is plentiful, penalties are suffered when [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food is scarce.
Chivalry Gained

Hoarder
Click the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_button]]Recruit Lord button[[/sl_tooltip]] with a controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] selected to open the Recruit Lord panel.
Available [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords, along with any existing [[sl:campaign_character_details]]traits[[/sl]] and the cost of raising them, are shown in a list on the Recruit Lord panel.

[[sl:campaign_hordes]]Horde factions[[/sl]] require [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, earned through [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_horde_growth]]horde growth[[/sl]], to raise new horde armies.

In addition to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruiting units[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire factions[[/sl]] may also raise the dead to fight for their cause, allowing them to build [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] more swiftly than other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]].

Improve it by sharing loot after battle or taking the action indicated in the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord's starting trait.[[/col]]\n\n[[col:red]]Disbanding the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord now may lead to a rebellion![[/col]]
Beast-path Interception!
Sacrifice of Axlotl\n\n[[col:green]][[img:icon_spawning]][[/img]]Unlocks Star Chamber Guardians (Temple Guard)

The Great Warding is bolstered and the Geomantic energies flow once more. Our many enemies sense their plans are in jeopardy and gather to stop you, but your attention must turn to the Rat-spawn that defile the Isle of the Dead at the centre of Ulthuan. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Rat-spawn must be purged and the Vortex restored. This is the will of the Old Ones - prepare for the ultimate battle!

Population surplus cost||This is the amount of [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus required to construct this building. This cost can increase as you construct additional horde buildings.
Income from horde buildings:

The current growth towards the next [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus point and the growth acquired next turn are shown on the growth information panel. When growth reaches its threshold a [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus point is earned.
Details about a Book of Nagash may be viewed by selecting it on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_books_of_nagash_panel]]Books of Nagash panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

Corruption affects [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}. Should corruption become too high, then the forces of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos, [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampire Counts or [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven will emerge in the province. A high level of corruption can cause armies to suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.
Engagement options such as whether to attack or withdraw appear immediately prior to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]].
As the Black Ark grows, its [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus can be used to construct new buildings.
Supply Lines
This is the amount of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber required to construct this building, as well as any previous buildings in the chain.
Encounters at Sea
Espionage
The slaves are brought to the altar of Mathlann, Lord of the Deeps; their sacrifice ensures the seas are for the Druchii alone.

Ptra is pleased, for the desert gods have returned and are a force in the world once again. Nehekhara is resurgent – the greatest of all civilisations returns to prominence and domination. The mightiest kings and queens sit upon thrones of bone and look down upon the living with jealous contempt. Now, the Realm of Souls splits asunder and the Day of Awakening is at hand!

Left-click to begin digging.

[[col:yellow]]Whilst digging for treasure, [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes cannot act against other targets.[[/col]]
As the [[img:icon_pirate_crew]][[/img]]pirate crew grows, its [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus can be used to construct new ship buildings.
Intervention Armies

[[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]Plagues can be transferred by contact between armies and settlements. Isolating infected settlements and armies can help to prevent the [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague from spreading further.
Due to its high virulence, a [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague will eventually run its course and expire over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].
The Treasury panel, like other main panels, may be opened by a keyboard shortcut. For the Treasury panel this is the 7 key by default.
[[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]Plagues are generated by a Skaven faction performing the [[sl:campaign_rites]]rite[[/sl]] of the Pestilent Scheme.
Once the rite is performed, a [[sl:campaign_heroes]]Pestilent Scheme Priest[[/sl]] appears under the control of the summoning [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

A [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Pestilent Scheme Priest may infect a target enemy or settlement by performing a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]heroic action[[/sl]]. The priest is destroyed when the infection begins.
Selected units may be grouped together by pressing the G key, or by clicking the Group button at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface.
Stories speak of rivals, cursed to watch as this pirate’s spoils grow larger and theirs diminish. Such is the way of the sea, where larceny and death are the primary currencies.

Various factors can improve [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}, such as certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and the stationing of [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] in the province [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
Chapter Objectives

The [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness of a [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] is a measure of its desire for [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], and increases the more battles it engages in. If it gets high enough a [[sl:campaign_waaagh]]Waaagh![[/sl]] may be triggered.

Tales of crew who serve under Undead pirate captains state that they were press-ganged to remain under the sway of their admiral, not just for decades but forever. It is best, then, to embrace such fortune, for fate is rarely kind to deserters.
Clear Waaagh! target
The Chaos Gods approve of risk, but will their gifts be generous or deliberating?
Imbued with Dark Magic, Wight Kings unwillingly carry out the murderous instructions of their Unliving masters.

Diplomacy

At the start of the campaign, only the first tier of Sacrifices to Sotek will appear available. Higher-tier sacrifices can be unlocked by completing the requirements of the prophecy, outlined in the tooltip on the Prophecy of Sotek panel at the top of the main campaign interface.
Way-Fragment Details
The Great Gamble

Yet your empire is not one of petty territory, rather it is an empire of blood and Chaos, where mighty Champions rise and fall, striving ceaselessly against each other for the favour of the Dark Gods. And at their pinnacle you stand, mighty and unvanquished, Lord of All, and most favoured by the Gods of Chaos!
This button opens the Character Details panel on the Skills tab, showing the selected character's skills. The number and colourisation indicates their current skillset.
{{tr:hp_battle_point_5_unit_cards}}

Rogue [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] are warbands of desperate outlaws, and are often comprised of unusual combinations of troops. Rogue armies will appear from time to time, and will eventually seek to establish a permanent presence on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] by colonising a ruin or assaulting an occupied [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].

Ever-watchful for a chance to strike at their mortal enemies, the hateful Dark Elves have taken advantage of the discord wrought by the comet's appearance to launch an invasion of Ulthuan, the divine home of the High Elves. Lothern, the High Elf capital city and seat of the Phoenix King, is gravely threatened.\nCursing his brother's absence, and with the few forces at his disposal, Tyrion marches south to lead the counterattack.
Extorted Income
The Strategic Overview can be toggled on and off by zooming the camera.
Zones of Control
Enemy units are also not visible beyond a maximum range, even if there is line of sight.
Seek to control high ground to get an overview of the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]].
[[sl:battle_flying_units]]Flying units[[/sl]] can be used to gain line-of-sight to the enemy.
Most units can hide in forests, even within line of sight.
Sorcery and science, when fused together, can deny the foe advantage in war.
The [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership state of a unit is shown on its tooltip.
A unit’s banner flashes and then turns white when it wavers and routs.
Units can be demoralised by allies routing, meaning that a [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership failure can propagate across an [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]].
Routing units may be [[sl:battle_rallying]]rallied[[/sl]] by the army [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lord[[/sl]], or they may rally of their own accord.
Vampiric units do not rout but begin to crumble instead, continuing to fight but taking damage over time.
[[col:red]]This [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero cannot currently dig for treasure.[[/col]]

Pirates, both living and dead, are the deadly scourge of the high seas, and woe betide any who sight their black sails upon the horizon. By raiding and pillaging across the Great Ocean they compete with one another for [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_infamy]]Infamy[[/sl]].
Province Management
Like units, [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes cost upkeep to maintain, so be careful not to hire more than you can afford.
An army under attack may be able to decline and withdraw if there is room to retreat.
The player may choose to fight a battle on the battlefield or [[sl:campaign_autoresolving]]auto-resolve[[/sl]] the outcome.
Any nearby forces [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]allied to the attacker or defender may appear in the battle as [[sl:campaign_reinforcements]]reinforcements[[/sl]].

Large battles will leave [[img:icon_battle_site]][[/img]]battle markers, which provide a bonus to any [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] factions [[sl:campaign_raising_dead]]raising the dead[[/sl]] nearby.
An army attacking a fortified settlement will first have to overcome the defences, most commonly by laying [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]].
The more intelligent among the Skaven race are able to restrain themselves from killing unless it is absolutely necessary.
Settlement Climates
Runes and banners can be won in battle, and may be assigned to specific units in order to improve their performance.
Foreign Slot Established
The list of items available through the Mortuary Cult may be filtered by clicking the buttons at the top of the Mortuary Cult panel.
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_corruption_link]]Corruption[[/sl_tooltip]]
The Empire is fractured into multiple [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] at the start of the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign game[[/sl]].
The armies of the Empire are flexible and mighty, combining massed numbers, traditional weaponry, advanced engineering and powerful sorcery.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] within the Empire may be promoted to [[sl:campaign_offices]]office[[/sl]] once sufficiently experienced.

This [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord's army has low [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]][[url:script_link_campaign_fightiness]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_fightiness}}]]fightiness[[/tooltip]][[/url]]:
Diversionary

Bretonnian [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Paladins can gain the three Knightly Vows by choosing a pledge and completing a task in accordance with it in return for rewards.
Vows and Troths can be accessed through the Vows tab on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
Equally, Prophetesses can pledge towards the three Troths of the Lady through solemn service to her, which in turn bring their own benefits if completed.
Once the requirements of a pledge are completed, the character is awarded the associated Vow’s benefits and the next one becomes available.
The tooltip on each pledge button outlines the requirements to fulfil the Vow or Troth.
A thoroughly unprincipled, utterly immoral, devious, green-skinned little git; a prince among his kind.

A ritual may be initiated by clicking the corresponding button on the [[sl:campaign_rituals_bar]]Rituals bar[[/sl]]. Once initiated, a ritual takes several [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] to complete.
Rival powers can attempt to interrupt the ritual by attacking the ritual sites, and may hire [[sl:campaign_intervention_armies]]intervention armies[[/sl]] to support their assault.
The Infamy list is shown when placing the mouse cursor over the [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy value.

A ritual is conducted at several ritual sites across the campaign map, the locations of which are indicated on the Rituals bar while casting. While a ritual is underway, energy is channelled from these sites to the Great Vortex.
A ritual may be interrupted by capturing one of the ritual sites. Failed rituals may be attempted again after a short time.
While a ritual is underway the forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] will seep into the world, and may attack the ritual sites.

The [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth of a [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]] is a measure of the expansion of its population. [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth of a horde leads to the accumulation of [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, which can be spent on [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]raising additional hordes[[/sl]] or upgrading [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].
Public Order
The Geomantic Web button is only shown when playing as a Lizardmen faction.

[[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] armies may adopt [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]] to allow them to sense their surroundings more effectively. A Lizardmen [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] in [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance is much harder to surprise or evade.

Skaven [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] [[img:icon_stalking_stance]][[/img]]stalk their enemies by default, giving them a chance to [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ambushes]]ambush[[/sl]] even when attacking normally.

The Skaven spread [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven_corruption]]Skaven corruption[[/sl]] as they settle, which eventually makes [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] difficult to inhabit, even for Skaven.
Skaven armies consume [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_food]]food[[/sl]] over time. Penalties are experienced if [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food becomes scarce.

Skaven factions can spend {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to conduct [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] to gain powerful bonuses, or to summon special [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] that can cause earthquakes or spread [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_plagues]]plagues[[/sl]].
The [[sl:campaign_the_menace_below]]Menace Below[[/sl]] allows Skaven to summon additional units onto the battlefield during [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
Captives executed:
Loudly announcing your arrival isn't always the optimal way to carry out an assassination.
Only Avelorn is affected by the Mortal World's Torment.
Zoom to Waaagh! army

A Dark Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] gains [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves from victory in battle, and from [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]]. Captured [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves are distributed across the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] that faction holds.
A summary of [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves across all provinces may be seen by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_slaves_button]]Slaves button[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing as a Dark Elf faction.

The presence of [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] boosts the {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_tax]]tax income[[/sl]] generated there, but also lowers [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]].

The quantity of [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves in a province can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]] when playing as a Dark Elf faction. The proportion of [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves a particular province receives can also be adjusted here, by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_slaves_buttons]]Slaves buttons[[/sl_tooltip]] on the Province Info panel.
The number of [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves in a province will naturally decline over time, as they die from being overworked.
Those who are not part of the Great Plan must be prevented from interfering with its divine course.
A dedicated page about a particular unit can be opened by right-clicking on that unit's card on the Recruitment panel or Army panel.

The [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]]Green Knight is a powerful [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero who emerges for [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnian factions[[/sl]] in their hour of greatest need. The [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]]Green Knight excels in the ways of [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], but only appears for a limited period of [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].
Position the mouse cursor over a settlement to see lots of information about it at a glance.
This is the province's current [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus. It can be spent on upgrading the settlement building chain.
With a horde army selected, click the Building tab on the Army panel to show the Building panel.
Captives executed:
[[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]Trade-routes between ports are shown on the surface of the sea.

Queek Headtaker, the scion of Clan Mors, emerges from under the City of Pillars. Dispatched by Grey Seer Vulscreek at the behest of the Council of Thirteen, Warlord Queek and his forces are sent to a nest-lair under the ruined city of Yuatek, deep in the Southlands.\n\nQueek's task is to garner as much precious Warpstone as possible and repel a nascent invasion of hated Elf-things. The High Elf incursion is surely linked with the comet's appearance. In any case, Queek is thirsty for blood, and Elven blood flows the richest of all!
Lizardmen
Armies at sea are slow and vulnerable to attack, and should not stray too far from the coast lest they suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional casualties.
Raze or sack the following number of settlements
Units may be positioned within the designated deployment zone.
The attacker deploys before the defender. The defender may view the attacker’s arrangement during their own deployment.
Vanguard units may be positioned outside of their army’s deployment zone.
The defender has no chance to deploy during an [[sl:battle_ambush_battles]]ambush battle[[/sl]].
Beastmen
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_dynasties_link]]Dynasties[[/sl_tooltip]]
A faction breaking a [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]]non-aggression pact will incur significant diplomatic penalties which make it less likely that other factions will trust them in future.

Playing as the Cult of Sotek faction, [[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings can be acquired by winning battles and selecting “Mark for Sacrifice” from the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]post-battle options[[/sl]], or by successfully completing [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]].
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_post_battle_options_link]]Post-Battle Options[[/sl_tooltip]]
Eligible [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords are shown on the Offices panel, and may be dragged into a vacant position.
The tooltip on each office displayed on the Offices panel shows the [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] requirements for promotion.
Offices may be awarded on the Offices panel, which is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_offices_button]]Offices button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the user interface.

tax

[[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] may cast powerful spells to turn the tide of battle. Available spells are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_panel]]Winds of Magic panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when a Wizard unit is selected.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] must not ignore civic management if they are to avoid ruin. {{tr:icon_income}}Income must be balanced against expenditure and controlled territory must be [[sl:campaign_province_management]]managed effectively[[/sl]] if victory is to be achieved.
Brayherd
The Unit Exchange panel appears when a controlled army is sent to exchange units with another controlled army.
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_banners_and_marks_link]]Banners & Marks[[/sl_tooltip]]
The number of units that can be recruited in a turn from each pool is indicated on the Recruitment panel.
This panel contains all the collected treasure maps.
Select next province
Dark Elf Loyalty
The host army must have at least 17 [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] for a Waaagh! to occur.
A Waaagh! army will follow its host army and engage enemies in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] unless instructed otherwise.
A Waaagh! army may be assigned a separate target on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]] when the host army is selected.
The Waaagh! army will disperse when the [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness of the host army drops too low, or if the host army shrinks sufficiently.
Waaagh!
The Recruit Lord button is displayed on the Province Overview panel when a settlement is selected.

[[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]]Non-aggression pacts can be proposed and agreed on the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings are used to make Sacrifices to Sotek, which can be performed in the dedicated panel accessed via the button on the main campaign interface.
Low fightiness
Handsome, arrogant and charismatic, the von Carsteins are the true masters of men and beasts.
The Books of Nagash panel shows the location of each Book of Nagash on the campaign map.\n\nDouble-click a book icon to zoom to its location.
The Forge||Forge powerful items or recycle magic items to acquire [[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]]Oathgold.
Favour Summary Panel
The tab buttons showing available types of [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes are shown along the top of the Recruit Hero panel.
Pledge your devotion to a Dark God to gain their favour and be granted Ruinous gifts.

Unexplored areas on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] are obscured by the fog of war. The fog of war may be lifted by sending an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] to explore in that direction.
Unlike [[sl:campaign_elven_halls]]Elven Halls[[/sl]], Asrai Lookouts provide only one [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slot[[/sl]].
A Wood Elf faction earns a piece of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_amber]]Amber[[/sl]] by capturing or founding an Asrai Lookout. This is lost if the Lookout is lost or destroyed.
Only Wood Elves may construct or inhabit Asrai Lookouts. Lookouts may only be [[sl:campaign_razing]]razed[[/sl]] when captured by other races.

When checked, manual saves will be stored on the cloud allowing the campaign to be continued on any computer logged into this Steam account. [[col:yellow]]Manual saves will no longer be written to your hard drive.[[/col]]

Each rite must be unlocked before it may be used. The unlock criteria for a locked rite is shown on the panel.

Only Dwarf factions have access to The Forge.

The Siege panel is displayed when a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is placed under [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]]. It shows siege options and, if the settlement is [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]], allows [[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]] to be built prior to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth and [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].
The tooltip on the [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth stats on the Province Info panel shows the factors influencing [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth in the Province.

[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth in a province can be stimulated by certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_commandments]]commandments[[/sl]], and can be hindered by enemy [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]].

The [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus costs for upgrading a settlement are shown on the settlement building rollout on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
More [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]] become available when a settlement is upgraded.
Each Sacrifice to Sotek costs a number of [[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings. The greater Sotek’s reward, the greater the number of sacrifices required.

A rebellion [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] will appear and, if left to gather strength, may attack nearby [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].

Some buildings generate {{tr:icon_income}}income. This is only given to your faction when the province's income is being extorted.

Beast-paths permeate the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can be used by [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] to navigate through otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].

By using their stockpiles of {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]], and [[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_oathgold]]Oathgold[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarf[[/sl]] factions may forge powerful magic [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]].
Missile [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are best employed in battle to stand back from the action and fire, sling or hurl projectiles at the enemy.

To retain her youth and power the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elf[[/sl]] Crone Hellebron must scour the lands of her enemies, enslaving and using them for sport during ‘Death Night', a festival of murder which renews Hellebron and Har Ganeth’s power.
The number of items currently available for forging is shown next to The Forge button.

Seafarers through the ages have sung songs of great potency to empower their gun crews and boarders in battle. The most powerful of these is also the most elusive: the Lost Sea Shanty, which can grant the power to slay the sea-monster [[sl:campaign_amanar]]Amanar[[/sl]] in the Eye of the Vortex campaign.
